analyzed: dge 'dun las zhes smos pa de ni gang zag @223a * //
translated: The Saṅgha that is gathered is the one that is gathered in the present.🔽The Saṅgha that is not gathered is the one that is not gathered in the present.🔽The Saṅgha that is gathered and not gathered is the one that is both gathered and not gathered in the present.🔽The Saṅgha that is neither gathered nor not gathered is the one that is neither gathered nor not gathered in the present.

original: gi 'dus pa bsal ba'i don du'o //🔽dus ji tsam zhig brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gi 'dus pa bsal ba'i don du'o //🔽dus ji tsam zhig brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: The Saṅgha that is gathered is the one that is gathered in the present.🔽The Saṅgha that is not gathered is the one that is not gathered in the present.🔽The Saṅgha that is gathered and not gathered is the one that is both gathered and not gathered in the present.🔽The Saṅgha

original: de'i phyir gal te yun ring du spyad par bya ba nyid ma yin na nyin re zhing ngo zhes bya ba smos te gal te yongs su gnas pa yun ring du spyad par bya ba ma yin na nyin re lan re brjod par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te yun ring du spyad par bya ba nyid ma yin na nyin re zhing ngo zhes bya ba smos te gal te yongs su gnas pa yun ring du spyad par bya ba ma yin na nyin re lan re brjod par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, if it is not to be practiced for a long time, it is said to be daily. If the observance is not to be practiced for a long time, it is to be recited daily.

original: 'di la ni gsum mam bzhi zhing ngo zhes bya ba ni yun ring du spyad par bya ba nyid 'di la nyi ma gsum mam bzhi zhing lan re brjod par bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di la ni gsum mam bzhi zhing ngo zhes bya ba ni yun ring du spyad par bya ba nyid 'di la nyi ma gsum mam bzhi zhing lan re brjod par bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: Here, it is said to be for three or four days. In this practice for a long time, it is to be recited for three or four days.

original: de gnyis la don des brnyas thabs mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni yongs su gnas pa dang mgu bar bya ba spyod pa de gnyis la dge 'dun lhag ma dang kha na ma tho ba kun du spyod pa'i don des brnyas thabs mi bya'o //
analyzed: de gnyis la don des brnyas thabs mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni yongs su gnas pa dang mgu bar bya ba spyod pa de gnyis la dge 'dun lhag ma dang kha na ma tho ba kun du spyod pa'i don des brnyas thabs mi bya'o //
translated: One should not despise those two for that reason. One should not despise those two who are practicing observance and pleasing conduct for the reason of committing pārājika and pārājika-like offenses.

original: 'thab krol byed pa 'ong bar thos shing gal te des 'jigs na dge 'dun tshogs pa 'am gang zag la phyir btang bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni thams cad du 'thab krol byed cing rgol ba'i ngang tshul can la de la ched du 'gro
analyzed: 'thab krol byed pa 'ong bar thos shing gal te des 'jigs na dge 'dun tshogs pa 'am gang zag la phyir btang bar bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni thams cad du 'thab krol byed cing rgol ba'i ngang tshul can la de la ched du 'gro
translated: If you hear that a quarrel is coming and you fear it, then you should return to the community or to an individual.🔽This means that if you live in a place where quarrels are always occurring and you think that a quarrel will occur there,

original: ba nyid du gnas pa de 'dir 'thab krol byed par 'gyur snyam du 'byung bar 'gyur la 'thab krol byed pa gcig gam du ma 'ong bar thos shing /🔽gal te de dag gis gleng ba dang dran par byed pas 'jigs na spyod pa des 'khrug par gyur pa'i 'thab krol byed pa po gcig gam du ma 'ong bar ma thos par 'byung na /
analyzed: ba nyid du gnas pa de 'dir 'thab krol byed par 'gyur snyam du 'byung bar 'gyur la 'thab krol byed pa gcig gam du ma 'ong bar thos shing / gal te de dag gis gleng ba dang dran par byed pas 'jigs na spyod pa des 'khrug par gyur pa'i 'thab krol byed pa po gcig gam du ma 'ong bar ma thos par 'byung na /
translated: and if you hear that a quarrel is coming or that a quarrel has already occurred,

original: dge 'dun gyi drung ngam gang zag gam de dang mi mdza' ba nyid du gnas pas bdag nyid rang bzhin du gnas pa la gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi drung ngam gang zag gam de dang mi mdza' ba nyid du gnas pas bdag nyid rang bzhin du gnas pa la gzhag par bya'o //
translated: and if you fear that you will be accused or reminded of a past offense, then you should return to the community or to an individual or to someone who is not friendly with the person who is quarreling, and you should live in a natural way.

original: 'dir gzhung kha cig las rgan pa'i mthar gnas te yongs su gnas pa dang mi mdza' ba nyid du gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung kha cig las rgan pa'i mthar gnas te yongs su gnas pa dang mi mdza' ba nyid du gnas par bya'o //
translated: Here, some texts state: “One should remain at the end of the elder, remain completely, and remain as an enemy.”

original: dge 'dun la phyir btang ba'i sngags ni dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //🔽gzhan du yang gnyis po 'di dag gang zag la phyir btang ba'i sngags kyi gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gal te yongs su gnas par byed pa'i dgra bo 'ongs na /
analyzed: dge 'dun la phyir btang ba'i sngags ni dge 'dun btsun pa rnams gsan du gsol zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no // gzhan du yang gnyis po 'di dag gang zag la phyir btang ba'i sngags kyi gzhung ni zhu ba las btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis gal te yongs su gnas par byed pa'i dgra bo 'ongs na /
translated: The mantra for returning to the Saṅgha is stated as “Venerable Saṅgha, please listen!” and so on.

original: de yongs su gnas pa'i spyod pa bag yangs su bya'o zhes bka' stsal na des ji ltar bag yangs su bgyi /
analyzed: de yongs su gnas pa'i spyod pa bag yangs su bya'o zhes bka' stsal na des ji ltar bag yangs su bgyi /
translated: In other cases, these two are the mantra for returning to the individual. In the Questions of Upāli, it says: “Venerable! The Bhagavān has said, ‘If an enemy comes to fully restore the harmony, one should relax the conduct of full restoration.’ How should one relax it?”

original: nye ba 'khor dge slong des chos gos phrag pa gcig tu ste /
analyzed: nye ba 'khor dge slong des chos gos phrag pa gcig tu ste /
translated: “Upāli, that monk should put his Dharma robes on one shoulder,

original: 'chil lham dag phung nas dge slong gi @223b mdun du tsog pur 'dug ste 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'chil lham dag phung nas dge slong gi @223b mdun du tsog pur 'dug ste 'di skad ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: remove his sandals, squat in front of the monk, and say this:”

original: bdag dge slong yongs su gnas par bgyid pa'i dgra bo dge slong mchis te /
analyzed: bdag dge slong yongs su gnas par bgyid pa'i dgra bo dge slong mchis te /
translated: I, the monk so-and-so, have an enemy, a monk who is a non-observant monk.

original: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba yongs su gnas pa'i spyod pa bag yangs su bgyid cing slar yang len par bgyid do //
analyzed: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba yongs su gnas pa'i spyod pa bag yangs su bgyid cing slar yang len par bgyid do //
translated: I, so-and-so, will practice the conduct of a non-observant monk and take it up again.

original: yang blangs te spyod par bgyid na tshe dang ldan ba dag gis bdag ngo tsha ma mchis par gzung du gsol //🔽de bzhin du lan gnyis /
analyzed: yang blangs te spyod par bgyid na tshe dang ldan ba dag gis bdag ngo tsha ma mchis par gzung du gsol // de bzhin du lan gnyis /
translated: If I take it up again and practice it, may the Venerables consider me shameless.

original: lan gsum du bzlas /🔽thabs yin no legs so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: lan gsum du bzlas / thabs yin no legs so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Repeat this three times.

original: dgra bo song na phyir yang de bzhin du blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: dgra bo song na phyir yang de bzhin du blang bar bya ste /
translated: The method is good. It is said that if the enemy leaves, one should take it up again in the same way.

original: de ni yongs su gnas pa dang mgu bar bya bar spyod pa yin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni yongs su gnas pa dang mgu bar bya bar spyod pa yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: That is the conduct of a non-observant monk and one who delights in it.

original: de la gnyis ka'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba 'di gnyis ka bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de la gnyis ka'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba 'di gnyis ka bsdus pa'o //
translated: Here, both are included in this both-ways practice.

original: 'jigs dang bral na de nyid du phyir blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi drung ngam gang zag la'o //
analyzed: 'jigs dang bral na de nyid du phyir blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyi drung ngam gang zag la'o //
translated: If one is free from fear, one should take it up again right there, either in the presence of the Saṅgha or an individual.

original: sa gzhan na gnas pa'i gzhi'o /
analyzed: sa gzhan na gnas pa'i gzhi'o /
translated: The basis is one who is on another stage.

original: // / yongs su gnas pa dang mgu bar bya ba spyod par rang bzhin du gnas pa dang lhan cig tu g-yogs ma gcig par nyal na nyin mtshan de bcad do zhes bya ba ni ji srid nyal ba'i nyin mtshan de yongs su gnas par bya ba dang mgu
analyzed: // / yongs su gnas pa dang mgu bar bya ba spyod par rang bzhin du gnas pa dang lhan cig tu g-yogs ma gcig par nyal na nyin mtshan de bcad do zhes bya ba ni ji srid nyal ba'i nyin mtshan de yongs su gnas par bya ba dang mgu
translated: If one who is undergoing probation or who is to be fully admitted sleeps under the same covering with one who is naturally inclined to be celibate, then that night is reckoned as cut off.

original: bar spyad pa'i zhag tu bgrang bar mi bya zhing bcad par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bar spyad pa'i zhag tu bgrang bar mi bya zhing bcad par bya ba'o //
translated: The night of sleeping with one who is naturally inclined to be celibate is not counted as a night of undergoing probation or of being fully admitted, and it is cut off.

original: 'dir gzhung ni yongs su gnas par byed pas rang bzhin du gnas pa dang lhan cig g-yogs ma gcig par nyal ba de'i nyin mtshan yongs su gnas pa dang / mgu bar bya ba spyod pa mi bgrang bar mtshan mo de bcad de bgrang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni yongs su gnas par byed pas rang bzhin du gnas pa dang lhan cig g-yogs ma gcig par nyal ba de'i nyin mtshan yongs su gnas pa dang / mgu bar bya ba spyod pa mi bgrang bar mtshan mo de bcad de bgrang bar bya'o //
translated: Here the text says that the night of sleeping under the same covering as one who is naturally inclined to be celibate is not counted as a night of undergoing probation or of being fully admitted, and it is cut off.

original: mgu bar bya ba spyod pa yang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mgu bar bya ba spyod pa yang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The night of being fully admitted is also like that.

original: mtshams kyi phyi rol du spyad pa yang ngo zhes bya ba yang nyal na nyin mtshan de bcad do zhes bya ba'i rjes snyegs pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi rol du spyad pa yang ngo zhes bya ba yang nyal na nyin mtshan de bcad do zhes bya ba'i rjes snyegs pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
translated: The word also is stated because it is a continuation of the statement, If one sleeps, one should count that day and night as cut off.

original: ma brjod na yang ngo zhes bya ba yongs su gnas pa dang mgu bar bya ba spyod pa zhag 'das pa dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma brjod na yang nyin mtshan de bcad par bya'o //
analyzed: ma brjod na yang ngo zhes bya ba yongs su gnas pa dang mgu bar bya ba spyod pa zhag 'das pa dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma brjod na yang nyin mtshan de bcad par bya'o //
translated: If one does not state it, one should count that day and night as cut off, even if one does not state that one has passed the night or that one will engage in the rite of pleasing the preceptor.🔽If those who are to be heard from are not present in that boundary, it does not arise.

original: thos par bya ba dag mtshams de na nye bar mi 'khod na mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni mtshams gang du de spyad par bya ba'i mtshams de gang na mang du thos par bya ba rnams la nye bar mi gnas na ma brjod pa de mi 'byung
analyzed: thos par bya ba dag mtshams de na nye bar mi 'khod na mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba ni mtshams gang du de spyad par bya ba'i mtshams de gang na mang du thos par bya ba rnams la nye bar mi gnas na ma brjod pa de mi 'byung
translated: If those who are to be heard from are not present in the boundary where one is to engage in the rite, then it does not arise if one does not state it.

original: ba'o // nyi ma de nyid la phyir 'ong na @224a * //
analyzed: ba'o // nyi ma de nyid la phyir 'ong na @224a * //
translated: If one returns on that very day,

original: mtshams gzhan du 'gro ba la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: mtshams gzhan du 'gro ba la nyes pa med do //
translated: there is no fault in going to another boundary.

original: yongs su gnas par byed pas yongs su gnas par byed pa dang lhan cig g-yogs ma gcig par nyal bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni nyin mtshan spyad par ni mi 'gyur mod kyi 'on kyang nyin mtshan gyi mtha' nyes byas rdzogs par 'gyur la /🔽de'i mdun rol du ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i nyes byas su 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //🔽rang bzhin du gnas pa dang lhan cig nyal ba yang kha na ma tho ba de gnyis su 'gyur ba'i steng du de'i nyin mtshan bcad par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su gnas par byed pas yongs su gnas par byed pa dang lhan cig g-yogs ma gcig par nyal bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni nyin mtshan spyad par ni mi 'gyur mod kyi 'on kyang nyin mtshan gyi mtha' nyes byas rdzogs par 'gyur la / de'i mdun rol du ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i nyes byas su 'gyur bar shes par bya'o // rang bzhin du gnas pa dang lhan cig nyal ba yang kha na ma tho ba de gnyis su 'gyur ba'i steng du de'i nyin mtshan bcad par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Although one does not practice day and night, still the fault of completing the day and night is incurred.🔽And in addition to the two faults of sleeping with one who is fully ordained and of sleeping with a woman, one also incurs the fault of interrupting the day and night.

original: de dang mu stegs can yongs su gnas pa la gnas pa dang / der lhan cig pa la ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni der lhan cig pa la zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can gyi gnas der ro //
analyzed: de dang mu stegs can yongs su gnas pa la gnas pa dang / der lhan cig pa la ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba ni der lhan cig pa la zhes bya ba ni mu stegs can gyi gnas der ro //
translated: There is no fault if one sleeps with a heretic who is fully ordained, or if one sleeps with a woman in that place.

original: der zhes bya ba ni nyal sa der ro //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni nyal sa der ro //
translated: In that place means in the place where one sleeps.

original: ci'i phyir yang yongs su gnas pa'i gzhi las gzhan na gnas pa'i spyod pa'i gzhi zhes ming gzhan du byas she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yang yongs su gnas pa'i gzhi las gzhan na gnas pa'i spyod pa'i gzhi zhes ming gzhan du byas she na /
translated: Why is the basis of conduct for one who is not fully ordained called by a different name, the basis of training?

original: sa gzhan na gnas pa dang mgu bar bya ba spyod pa dang / bslab pa byin pa la sogs pa gzhan na gnas pa gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad gzhi 'dis spyod par bstan gyi /
analyzed: sa gzhan na gnas pa dang mgu bar bya ba spyod pa dang / bslab pa byin pa la sogs pa gzhan na gnas pa gang ji snyed pa de dag thams cad gzhi 'dis spyod par bstan gyi /
translated: The basis of training is taught as the conduct for all those who are not fully ordained, such as those who are ordained in other schools, those who are pleased by conduct, those who have received the precepts, and so on.

original: yongs su gnas pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad pas de'i don de bstan pa'i phyir de shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su gnas pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad pas de'i don de bstan pa'i phyir de shes par bya'o //
translated: It is not just for those who are fully ordained. Therefore, it should be understood for the purpose of teaching that meaning.

original: sa gzhan na gnas pa spyod pa'i gzhi zhu ba'i skabs so //
analyzed: sa gzhan na gnas pa spyod pa'i gzhi zhu ba'i skabs so //
translated: This concludes the section on asking about the basis of conduct for one who is not fully ordained.

original: sa gzhan na gnas pa spyod pa'i gzhi rdzogs so /
analyzed: sa gzhan na gnas pa spyod pa'i gzhi rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the basis of conduct for one who is not fully ordained.🔽The basis of training is not for those who are not well known.

original: // / ma grags pa ni gzhi nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa rnams ni zhe sdang gis 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: // / ma grags pa ni gzhi nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa rnams ni zhe sdang gis 'jug pa yin te /
translated: The desire realms are entered through aversion.

original: drang po ma yin pa la brten nas 'di rnams la mi'i chos bla mar gyur pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: drang po ma yin pa la brten nas 'di rnams la mi'i chos bla mar gyur pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why do these become the highest human qualities based on dishonesty?

original: de la tha dad du bya ba ma yin pa ltung ba'i tha snyad kha cig sdig pa 'dod pa rnams kyis de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid 'jug pa rnams kyis dge slong rnams nyams par byas pa de bas na 'di rnam par gzhag go ;
analyzed: de la tha dad du bya ba ma yin pa ltung ba'i tha snyad kha cig sdig pa 'dod pa rnams kyis de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid 'jug pa rnams kyis dge slong rnams nyams par byas pa de bas na 'di rnam par gzhag go ;
translated: Some who are not to be distinguished from those who are to be expelled, who are of that nature, who are corrupting the monks, are to be expelled.

original: / ma grags pa des ci'i phyir gleng bar mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: / ma grags pa des ci'i phyir gleng bar mi bya zhe na /
translated: Why should one not speak of what is not well known?

original: kha cig mi'i chos bla ma dang ldan pas sngags kyang sman gyis byas pa 'am /
analyzed: kha cig mi'i chos bla ma dang ldan pas sngags kyang sman gyis byas pa 'am /
translated: Some have the quality of being human, and some are created by spells or by medicine,

original: skye ba las byung ba gang yin pa 'di lta ste dper na 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: skye ba las byung ba gang yin pa 'di lta ste dper na 'khor los sgyur ba la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: or they are born, such as the wheel-turning kings and so on.

original: ting nge 'dzin las grub pa 'am mnyam @224b par ma bzhag pa'i sa la gnas pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las grub pa 'am mnyam @224b par ma bzhag pa'i sa la gnas pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Some are accomplished through concentration, or they abide on the level of non-equipoise.

original: bye brag can gyi yon tan rnams kyi rigs las byung ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams so //
analyzed: bye brag can gyi yon tan rnams kyi rigs las byung ba ni 'dod pa na spyod pa rnams so //
translated: Some are born from the class of specific qualities, such as those who enjoy desire.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here is the text:

original: dge slong dag lha'i mig ni tha snyad du bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: dge slong dag lha'i mig ni tha snyad du bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Monks, the divine eye is not to be spoken of conventionally.

original: de bas na dge slong gis lha'i mig gis mthong bas gleng bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas de bzhin du lha'i rna bas gleng bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar du gsungs pa yin no zhe na bden mod kyi /🔽gzhan du yang grags pa las mi 'da' bas byas nas 'di la 'dod pa nyid rnam par gnas pa yin te skyon mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na dge slong gis lha'i mig gis mthong bas gleng bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba nas de bzhin du lha'i rna bas gleng bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i bar du gsungs pa yin no zhe na bden mod kyi / gzhan du yang grags pa las mi 'da' bas byas nas 'di la 'dod pa nyid rnam par gnas pa yin te skyon mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: This is true, but since he does not transgress what is well known to others, he is still considered to be a monk.🔽The fault is the same.

original: tha snyad du byas pa ma yin zhes smos pas log par rtog pa de bas na 'di ltar sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: tha snyad du byas pa ma yin zhes smos pas log par rtog pa de bas na 'di ltar sbyar ba'o //
translated: Since it is said that he does not do it conventionally, this is applied in this way to avoid that misconception.

original: dgag dbye brjod pa rdzogs na dgag dbye gzhag pa mi 'chags so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dgag dbye brjod pa rdzogs na dgag dbye gzhag pa mi 'chags so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If the announcement of the end of the rains retreat is completed, the postponement of the end of the rains retreat is not established.

original: gang zag gang gis dgag dbye brjod pa rdzogs na mi 'chags pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag gang gis dgag dbye brjod pa rdzogs na mi 'chags pa'o //
translated: If the announcement of the end of the rains retreat is completed by a certain person, it is not established.

original: dgag dbye brjod pa rdzogs par dgag dbye 'jog par byed na ni 'chags so //
analyzed: dgag dbye brjod pa rdzogs par dgag dbye 'jog par byed na ni 'chags so //
translated: If the postponement of the end of the rains retreat is done after the announcement of the end of the rains retreat is completed, it is established.

original: dgag dbye'i sngags lan cig brjod pa la ni de'i mthar phyin pa nyid brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: dgag dbye'i sngags lan cig brjod pa la ni de'i mthar phyin pa nyid brjod pa yin te /
translated: When the formula for the lifting of restrictions is recited once, the conclusion of that is stated.

original: lan gnyis brjod pa la ni gnyis pa'i mthar phyin pa nyid rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: lan gnyis brjod pa la ni gnyis pa'i mthar phyin pa nyid rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: When it is recited twice, the conclusion of the second is completed.

original: lan gsum du brjod pa gsum pa'i mthar phyin pa nyid rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: lan gsum du brjod pa gsum pa'i mthar phyin pa nyid rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: When it is recited three times, the conclusion of the third is completed.

original: dgag dbye'i gzhi las de la sogs pas dran pa nye bar gzhag ste zhes bya ba nas shes bzhin zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dgag dbye'i gzhi las de la sogs pas dran pa nye bar gzhag ste zhes bya ba nas shes bzhin zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The basis for the lifting of restrictions states: “Having placed mindfulness in that, up to having placed introspection in that.”

original: byed pa po nad pa dang ldan pa nyid la yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gal te dgag dbye 'jog pa po nad par gyur na des dgag dbye 'jog tu 'jug pa yang snga ma bzhin du mi 'chags pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don
analyzed: byed pa po nad pa dang ldan pa nyid la yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gal te dgag dbye 'jog pa po nad par gyur na des dgag dbye 'jog tu 'jug pa yang snga ma bzhin du mi 'chags pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i don
translated: The same is true for the one who is sick. If the one who is lifting the restrictions becomes sick, the one who is asked to lift the restrictions does not do so, as before.

original: to // ci des mngon sum du 'jog pa mi 'chags par zad dam zhe na /
analyzed: to // ci des mngon sum du 'jog pa mi 'chags par zad dam zhe na /
translated: Does this mean that the one who is sick cannot lift the restrictions in person?

original: de'i phyir mngags pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba las kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rang gis 'jog tu 'jug na yang mi 'chags so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir mngags pas kyang ngo zhes bya ba las kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras ni rang gis 'jog tu 'jug na yang mi 'chags so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word “also” means that if one is made to set it aside by another, it is not set aside.

original: nad pa nyid la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni gal te gzhan gyis nad pa'i dgag dbye 'jog par byed na /
analyzed: nad pa nyid la yang ngo zhes bya ba ni gal te gzhan gyis nad pa'i dgag dbye 'jog par byed na /
translated: Also, if one is sick, if another sets aside the poṣadha for one who is sick,

original: des kyang nad pa'i dgag dbye gzhag pa mi 'chags pa'o //🔽'dir dgag dbye zhes smos pas ni gso @225a * //
analyzed: des kyang nad pa'i dgag dbye gzhag pa mi 'chags pa'o // 'dir dgag dbye zhes smos pas ni gso @225a * //
translated: then it is not set aside by that one who is sick.

original: sbyong dang gdams ngag gzhag pa la yang cho ga 'di rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyong dang gdams ngag gzhag pa la yang cho ga 'di rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, since the poṣadha is mentioned, this rite should be known for the poṣadha, instruction, and setting aside.🔽One should not take it up.

original: de mnod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang zhig dgag dbye gzhag pa mi 'chags pa bstan pa gang yin pa de mnod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de mnod par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang zhig dgag dbye gzhag pa mi 'chags pa bstan pa gang yin pa de mnod par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not take up that which is taught as not setting aside the poṣadha.🔽The venerable one who is sick is unable to join.

original: tshe dang ldan pa nad pa ni sbyor mi bzod pa yin gyi khyed sdod cig ce 'am /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa nad pa ni sbyor mi bzod pa yin gyi khyed sdod cig ce 'am /
translated: You should wait.

original: tshe dang ldan pa pho nya de la ni brgal zhing brtag pa ma yin no zhes lan gdab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gal te nad pa rang gi dgag dbye 'jog tu 'jud na de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa nad pa ni sbyor mi bzod pa yin
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa pho nya de la ni brgal zhing brtag pa ma yin no zhes lan gdab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gal te nad pa rang gi dgag dbye 'jog tu 'jud na de'i tshe tshe dang ldan pa nad pa ni sbyor mi bzod pa yin
translated: If the sick one himself makes the sick one stay, then the venerable sick one is unable to join the assembly.

original: gyi khyod rang sdod cig ces lan gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: gyi khyod rang sdod cig ces lan gdab par bya'o //
translated: One should reply, You stay here.

original: 'on te nad pas mngags pa de la tshe dang ldan pa pho nya nad pa de la brgal zhing brtag par bya ba ma yin no zhes lan gdab par bya'o //🔽byas pa dang byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo ma rtogs pa nyid na yang gleng ba mi 'chags so zhes bya ba la byas pa'i rang gi ngo bo ma rtogs pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'phags pa che ge mos nyes pa byas pa zhes thos kyis nyes
analyzed: 'on te nad pas mngags pa de la tshe dang ldan pa pho nya nad pa de la brgal zhing brtag par bya ba ma yin no zhes lan gdab par bya'o // byas pa dang byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo ma rtogs pa nyid na yang gleng ba mi 'chags so zhes bya ba la byas pa'i rang gi ngo bo ma rtogs pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'phags pa che ge mos nyes pa byas pa zhes thos kyis nyes
translated: If the messenger is sent by the sick one, one should reply, It is not proper to question the messenger, the venerable sick one.🔽Even if one does not understand the nature of what was done and what is being done, one should not confess the offense.

original: pa 'di dang 'di lta bu byas zhes bya ba ma thos so zhes zer ba'o //
analyzed: pa 'di dang 'di lta bu byas zhes bya ba ma thos so zhes zer ba'o //
translated: Not understanding the nature of what was done means saying, I heard that the noble one committed an offense, but I did not hear that such and such an offense was committed.

original: byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo ma rtogs pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'phags pas nyes pa 'di dang 'di lta bu byas zhes ni thos kyi che ge mo zhig gis ni ma thos so zhes zer ba ste /
analyzed: byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo ma rtogs pa nyid ces bya ba ni 'phags pas nyes pa 'di dang 'di lta bu byas zhes ni thos kyi che ge mo zhig gis ni ma thos so zhes zer ba ste /
translated: The phrase “not understanding the nature of the act and the nature of the agent” means that the monk does not understand that he has committed a transgression, and he does not understand that he has been accused of a transgression.

original: de ltar byas pa dang byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo ma rtogs pa nyid yin na yang gleng ba mi 'chags so //
analyzed: de ltar byas pa dang byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo ma rtogs pa nyid yin na yang gleng ba mi 'chags so //
translated: Even though he does not understand the nature of the act and the nature of the agent, he is still required to confess the transgression.

original: lhag mas kyang dus ma yin par 'jug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la gnas gang du gleng bar bya ba'i gang zag de'i bsrung bar bya ba rnams kyi mdun du des bdag la brnyas thabs byas par 'gyur ba'i gnas de las lhag mas kyang zhes bya bas
analyzed: lhag mas kyang dus ma yin par 'jug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la gnas gang du gleng bar bya ba'i gang zag de'i bsrung bar bya ba rnams kyi mdun du des bdag la brnyas thabs byas par 'gyur ba'i gnas de las lhag mas kyang zhes bya bas
translated: The phrase “nor should he engage in the discussion at an inappropriate time” means that he should not engage in the discussion in the presence of the persons who are to be protected by the accused monk, because that would provide an opportunity for the accused to humiliate him.

original: ni byed pa po nad pa la sogs pas gleng ba de las gzhan bas kyang dus ma yin par 'jug par mi bya'i dus su 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: ni byed pa po nad pa la sogs pas gleng ba de las gzhan bas kyang dus ma yin par 'jug par mi bya'i dus su 'jug par bya'o //
translated: The phrase “nor should he engage in the discussion at an inappropriate time” means that he should not engage in the discussion at an inappropriate time, such as when the accused is sick, etc.

original: dran pa dang shes bzhin nye bar ma gzhag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dran pa dang shes bzhin nye bar ma gzhag par mi bya'o //
translated: He should also not engage in the discussion without maintaining mindfulness and vigilance.

original: mtha' ma yin par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnas gang du gleng bar bya ba'i gang zag de'i bsrung bar bya ba rnams kyi mdun du des dag la brnyas thabs byas par 'gyur ba'i gnas de las gzhan ba'i gleng bar bya ba des 'jug par bya ba'i
analyzed: mtha' ma yin par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnas gang du gleng bar bya ba'i gang zag de'i bsrung bar bya ba rnams kyi mdun du des dag la brnyas thabs byas par 'gyur ba'i gnas de las gzhan ba'i gleng bar bya ba des 'jug par bya ba'i
translated: The meaning is that one should not engage in the discussion in a place other than where the person who is the subject of the discussion is, in front of those who are to be protected by him, because that would be a basis for contempt by them.

original: don to // lcags kyi gsal zhing can nyid ni dam pa rnams kyis smad par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don to // lcags kyi gsal zhing can nyid ni dam pa rnams kyis smad par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of an iron hook is to be despised by the virtuous.🔽One should not engage without making an opening.

original: @225b skabs 'byed du ma bcug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang du gang zag gang la skabs 'byed du ma bcug par gleng ba la 'jug par mi bya ste de ni rab tu 'khrug pa spang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: @225b skabs 'byed du ma bcug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang du gang zag gang la skabs 'byed du ma bcug par gleng ba la 'jug par mi bya ste de ni rab tu 'khrug pa spang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: One should not engage in the discussion without making an opening for the person who is the subject of the discussion. That is because it would be a cause of great disturbance.

original: dgag dbye ni de nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dgag dbye ni de nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The lifting of restrictions is just that.

original: gang gi dgag dbye'i tshe dge 'dun las dgag dbye byas pa de ni skabs phyed pa nyid yin pas de'i phyir dgag dbye byed pa ni gleng ba la 'jug pa ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi dgag dbye'i tshe dge 'dun las dgag dbye byas pa de ni skabs phyed pa nyid yin pas de'i phyir dgag dbye byed pa ni gleng ba la 'jug pa ni nyes pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: When the invitation is made to the Saṅgha, the invitation is made to the Saṅgha at that time. Therefore, there is no fault in engaging in discussion when the invitation is made.

original: mi dran pa na dran par bya'o zhes bya ba ni glengs pa na mi dran na dran du gzhug go //
analyzed: mi dran pa na dran par bya'o zhes bya ba ni glengs pa na mi dran na dran du gzhug go //
translated: If one does not remember, one should be reminded. If one does not remember when one is discussed, one should be reminded.

original: dran par bya ba ni gleng ba'i 'khor yin pas de'i phyir ji ltar gleng ba la dus ma yin par 'jug pa mi bya ba dang / dran pa dang shes bzhin nye bar ma bzhag par mi bya ba dang / skabs 'byed du ma bcug par mi bya'o zhes ji skad smos pa de dag dran par bya ba'i skabs 'dir yang grub pa yin no //
analyzed: dran par bya ba ni gleng ba'i 'khor yin pas de'i phyir ji ltar gleng ba la dus ma yin par 'jug pa mi bya ba dang / dran pa dang shes bzhin nye bar ma bzhag par mi bya ba dang / skabs 'byed du ma bcug par mi bya'o zhes ji skad smos pa de dag dran par bya ba'i skabs 'dir yang grub pa yin no //
translated: Since the assembly of those who are discussed is the assembly that is to be reminded, therefore, just as it is said that one should not engage in discussion at the wrong time, and one should not do so without being mindful and vigilant, and one should not do so without being invited, those things are established in this context of being reminded.

original: de mi byed na de la brjod pa dang bcas pa nyid bya'o zhes bya ba ni skabs 'byed pa de mi byed na gleng bar bya ba de la brjod pa dang bcas pa nyid bya'o //
analyzed: de mi byed na de la brjod pa dang bcas pa nyid bya'o zhes bya ba ni skabs 'byed pa de mi byed na gleng bar bya ba de la brjod pa dang bcas pa nyid bya'o //
translated: If he does not do the opening of the case, then he should be reproved with regard to the matter under discussion.

original: ma mo dag las cho ga dang bcas par brjod par bya ba nyid brjod pa'o //
analyzed: ma mo dag las cho ga dang bcas par brjod par bya ba nyid brjod pa'o //
translated: The reprover should state the matter under discussion as it was stated in the mother texts, together with the rules.

original: ji ltar brjod pa dang bcas pa nyid bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar brjod pa dang bcas pa nyid bya zhe na /
translated: How should he be reproved?

original: de'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa khyed la brjod pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis khyed kyis gnas 'di nas ma zhus par 'gro bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshe dang ldan pa khyed la brjod pa dang bcas pa nyid kyis khyed kyis gnas 'di nas ma zhus par 'gro bar mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, venerable one, you should not leave this place without asking about this matter, since you have been reproved.

original: kho bo la tshe dang ldan pa la brjod pa'i phyir bsdogs pa yod do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: kho bo la tshe dang ldan pa la brjod pa'i phyir bsdogs pa yod do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: I have a charge against the venerable one.

original: brjod par bya ba nyid du nges pa ni bsdogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba nyid du nges pa ni bsdogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The certainty of the matter to be reproved is called a charge.

original: des dul bar mi 'gyur ba mi gdams pa nyid du'o zhes bya ba ni de la brjod pa dang bcas pa nyid bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: des dul bar mi 'gyur ba mi gdams pa nyid du'o zhes bya ba ni de la brjod pa dang bcas pa nyid bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: If he is not disciplined by that, then he should not be instructed.

original: de la gtam 'dre ba la sogs pa yang bzlog par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mi gdams pa nyid du byas pa de la gdams shing rjes su bstan par bya ba nyid kyis phan gdags pa bzlog par bya ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi 'on kyang gtam
analyzed: de la gtam 'dre ba la sogs pa yang bzlog par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mi gdams pa nyid du byas pa de la gdams shing rjes su bstan par bya ba nyid kyis phan gdags pa bzlog par bya ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi 'on kyang gtam
translated: Also, one should stop talking to him, etc. means that one should not give advice to him who has been made to be without advice, and one should not benefit him by instructing and teaching him.

original: 'dre ba dang phebs par smra ba dang / so sor kun dga' bar bya ba'i tha snyad kyis tshig sbyin par yang mi bya'o //🔽de ltar na yang gso sbyong gzhag go zhes bya ba ni de ltar yang dul bar mi 'gyur zhing skabs mi 'byed na de'i tshe gso sbyong gzhag par bya'o //🔽des kyang ni dgag dbye'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar gzhag pa des kyang dul bar mi @226a * //
analyzed: 'dre ba dang phebs par smra ba dang / so sor kun dga' bar bya ba'i tha snyad kyis tshig sbyin par yang mi bya'o // de ltar na yang gso sbyong gzhag go zhes bya ba ni de ltar yang dul bar mi 'gyur zhing skabs mi 'byed na de'i tshe gso sbyong gzhag par bya'o // des kyang ni dgag dbye'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar gzhag pa des kyang dul bar mi @226a * //
translated: Not only that, but also one should not give him words by the convention of talking, speaking pleasantly, and pleasing each one.🔽 Thus, one should stop the poṣadha means that if he is not disciplined in that way and does not make an opportunity, then at that time the poṣadha should be stopped.

original: 'gyur zhing skabs mi 'byed na de'i tshe de'i dgag dbye gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gyur zhing skabs mi 'byed na de'i tshe de'i dgag dbye gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Also, one should stop the pravāraṇa means that if he is not disciplined in that way and does not make an opportunity, then at that time the pravāraṇa should be stopped.

original: gso sbyong dang dgag dbye gzhag par zhes bya ba ni gang zag 'di 'dug pa dang lhan cig dge slong rnams kyis gso sbyong dang dgag dbye mi bya'o zhes bya ba yin par rig par bya'o//🔽'jog par byed pa dag gis gzhan pa dang lhan cig tu bya ba yang 'dir bzod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gang dag gis gzhan pa gang yin ba dag dang lhan cig gso sbyong la sogs pa bya ba gang yin pa de yang skabs 'dir de
analyzed: gso sbyong dang dgag dbye gzhag par zhes bya ba ni gang zag 'di 'dug pa dang lhan cig dge slong rnams kyis gso sbyong dang dgag dbye mi bya'o zhes bya ba yin par rig par bya'o// 'jog par byed pa dag gis gzhan pa dang lhan cig tu bya ba yang 'dir bzod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gang dag gis gzhan pa gang yin ba dag dang lhan cig gso sbyong la sogs pa bya ba gang yin pa de yang skabs 'dir de
translated: The phrase to set aside the observance of the purificatory fast and the rainy season retreat should be understood to mean that the monks should not perform the purificatory fast and the rainy season retreat together with this individual.🔽The phrase the tolerance of the performance of these rites together with others means that in this context, the tolerance of the performance of the purificatory fast, etc., together with those other than the one who has been ejected is also required.

original: la bzod pa bya ba yin gyi tshig 'ba' zhig gis bzod pa bya zhing bag yangs su bya bar ma zad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: la bzod pa bya ba yin gyi tshig 'ba' zhig gis bzod pa bya zhing bag yangs su bya bar ma zad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this phrase is that the tolerance of the performance of these rites together with those other than the one who has been ejected is required, and not merely the tolerance of the performance of these rites together with the one who has been ejected. The phrase the tolerance of the performance of these rites together with others means that in this context, the tolerance of the performance of the purificatory fast, etc., together with those other than the one who has been ejected is also required.

original: 'dir gzhung ni drug sde dag gis 'gran dor gyi bsam pas dge slong gis gso sbyong gzhag pa dang / dge slong rab tu gnas pa thams cad kyis kyang khyed kyi gso sbyong drug sde dag gis gzhag go zhes gso sbyong las zlog par byed na yang drug sde dag gis gso sbyong bya'o zhes smras pa nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni drug sde dag gis 'gran dor gyi bsam pas dge slong gis gso sbyong gzhag pa dang / dge slong rab tu gnas pa thams cad kyis kyang khyed kyi gso sbyong drug sde dag gis gzhag go zhes gso sbyong las zlog par byed na yang drug sde dag gis gso sbyong bya'o zhes smras pa nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: If the monks do not listen, they should be expelled.

translated: Why is it called “with a stake”?🔽Therefore, it is said, “In this or another place, on this or another basis, one should agree to the desire,” and “Having laid out the downfall and shown the fault, one should release.”

original: de'i phyir gnas 'di'am gzhan du'am gzhi 'di 'am gang yang rung ba la 'dod par smra bar bya'o zhes bya ba dang / ltung ba bkal zhing nyes pa bstan te btang bas so zhes bya ba smos te gang yang rung ba la 'dod par bya zhes bya ba ni gnas sam gzhi la 'o //

translated: “On this or another basis” means in a place or on a basis.
