translated: If there is a donor for that monastery site, then if he approves, one should permit the establishment of a site for the Sangha or for an individual monk as a monastery.

original: grong khyer gyi phyi rol la lam nang du bsti ba'i gnas dag rung ngo zhes bya ba ni gang du dge slong dag bsong snyoms pa'i don du 'jug pa rnams kyi tsha ba dang / ngal ba rnams la sogs pa bsal ba'i phyir bsti ba'i gnas mi 'ong ba'i gnas zhes bya ba de byed du gzhug par rung ngo //
analyzed: grong khyer gyi phyi rol la lam nang du bsti ba'i gnas dag rung ngo zhes bya ba ni gang du dge slong dag bsong snyoms pa'i don du 'jug pa rnams kyi tsha ba dang / ngal ba rnams la sogs pa bsal ba'i phyir bsti ba'i gnas mi 'ong ba'i gnas zhes bya ba de byed du gzhug par rung ngo //
translated: It is proper to make a resting place outside the city, on the road means that it is proper to make a resting place called a place where one does not come in order to remove the heat, fatigue, and so on of those monks who enter for the sake of alms.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su gnang na bdag grong khyer gyi slang rol du bsti ba'i gnas bgyid du stsal te zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis rjes su gnang na bdag grong khyer gyi slang rol du bsti ba'i gnas bgyid du stsal te zhes bya ba nas /
translated: Here the text says, If the Blessed One allows it, I will make a resting place outside the city...

original: khyim bdag rjes su gnang gis rtsigs shig ces bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: khyim bdag rjes su gnang gis rtsigs shig ces bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: up to ... householder, I allow it, build it.

original: 'dir grong khyer gyi phyi rol du zhes gsungs pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir grong khyer gyi phyi rol du zhes gsungs pa ni /
translated: Here, the statement outside the city

original: byung ba'i dbang gis smos pa yin gyi /
analyzed: byung ba'i dbang gis smos pa yin gyi /
translated: is made due to the occurrence of that.

original: grong khyer gyi nang du yang @248b 'gal ba med pas 'dir gnyis ka mdor bsdus so //
analyzed: grong khyer gyi nang du yang @248b 'gal ba med pas 'dir gnyis ka mdor bsdus so //
translated: Since there is no contradiction even inside the city, both are included here.

original: rang gi khron pa bar du bcad pa'i phyir rtsig gu byas pas kun du chags pa'i shes pa bsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni bar du bcad pa'i phyir rtsig gu bya ba gang yin pa de byed pas bud med kyi tshogs la blta bar bya ba gsal🔽bar bya ste /
analyzed: rang gi khron pa bar du bcad pa'i phyir rtsig gu byas pas kun du chags pa'i shes pa bsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni bar du bcad pa'i phyir rtsig gu bya ba gang yin pa de byed pas bud med kyi tshogs la blta bar bya ba gsal bar bya ste /
translated: “One should make the view clear” means that one should make the wall in order to block the view of a group of women.

original: khron pa gzhan la cho ga 'di byed pa ma yin te de bas na rang gi khron pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: khron pa gzhan la cho ga 'di byed pa ma yin te de bas na rang gi khron pa'i tshig go //
translated: “One should not do this rite in another’s well,” means that one should do this rite in one’s own well.

analyzed: der bud med chu chur 'ongs pa mthong ba na kun du chags pa'i rkyen yin te /
translated: “When one sees a woman coming to the well for water, it is a condition for attachment,” means that when one sees a woman coming to one’s own well for water, attachment arises.

original: rtsig pas bar du chod pa med pa nyid la ni mthong ba med pa nyid kyi phyir chags pa skye ba'i rkyen du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtsig pas bar du chod pa med pa nyid la ni mthong ba med pa nyid kyi phyir chags pa skye ba'i rkyen du mi 'gyur te /
translated: “When there is no wall to block the view, attachment does not arise as a condition for seeing,” means that when there is no wall to block the view of a woman coming to one’s own well for water, attachment does not arise as a condition for seeing her.

original: de lta bas na de'i de nyid med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bas na de'i de nyid med pa nyid do //
translated: “Therefore, that is not the case.”

original: snyim pa bkang zhing blud pas bud med rjes su gzung bar bya zhing chu rgyun ma chad pas blugs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni bud med kyis chu snyim pa gang 'thungs zin nas snyim pa gnyis pa dgang zhing blud par bya'i /
analyzed: snyim pa bkang zhing blud pas bud med rjes su gzung bar bya zhing chu rgyun ma chad pas blugs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni bud med kyis chu snyim pa gang 'thungs zin nas snyim pa gnyis pa dgang zhing blud par bya'i /
translated: One should fill the cupped hands and give it to drink, but one should not pour it in a continuous stream.🔽This means that when a woman has finished drinking one cupped handful of water, one should fill and give her a second cupped handful.

original: snyim pa nas 'thung bzhin du chu'i rgyun phyi ma yang rgyun mi 'chad par blugs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snyim pa nas 'thung bzhin du chu'i rgyun phyi ma yang rgyun mi 'chad par blugs par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: But one should not pour a continuous stream of water while she is drinking from the cupped handful.

original: bud med gang zhig dge slong gi mdun du sems rab tu gtang pa de la rang gis sbyin par mi bya'o zhes bya ba /
analyzed: bud med gang zhig dge slong gi mdun du sems rab tu gtang pa de la rang gis sbyin par mi bya'o zhes bya ba /
translated: One should not give to a woman who has relaxed her mind in front of a monk.

original: 'dir kha cig byed pa de ni gzhan gyi sems shes par dka' ba nyid kyi phyir te /
analyzed: 'dir kha cig byed pa de ni gzhan gyi sems shes par dka' ba nyid kyi phyir te /
translated: Here, some say that this is because it is difficult to know the mind of another.

original: shin tu brel ba'i ngo bo ma yin no //
analyzed: shin tu brel ba'i ngo bo ma yin no //
translated: It is not the nature of being very busy.

original: bar bar du yang chu'i rgyun gcad par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bar bar du yang chu'i rgyun gcad par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should interrupt the stream of water from time to time.

original: gzhan de rnams chu ster ba la rnam par rtog pa byed pa de la yang tho 'tsham ba nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir mi rigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan de rnams chu ster ba la rnam par rtog pa byed pa de la yang tho 'tsham ba nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir mi rigs pa nyid do //
translated: The others are not suitable to be given a share of the rainy season robes, because they would be disrespectful to the one who is thinking of giving the water.

original: de'i dus nyid kyi dbyar gyi nang du 'ongs pa ni rnyed pa dbang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'dir rnyed pa la de'i sgra la ltos pa nyid de dus gang la yod pa zhes bya ba de bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dus nyid kyi dbyar gyi nang du 'ongs pa ni rnyed pa dbang ngo zhes bya ba ni 'dir rnyed pa la de'i sgra la ltos pa nyid de dus gang la yod pa zhes bya ba de bsdus pa'o //
translated: The phrase “at that time, those who come during the rainy season will receive a share of the robes” means that the word “at” refers to the time when the rainy season robes are received.

original: 'dir dbyar gyi rnyed pas dbyar gyi nang du 'ongs shing zhes bya ba 'di las shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir dbyar gyi rnyed pas dbyar gyi nang du 'ongs shing zhes bya ba 'di las shes pa'o //
translated: Here, the phrase “those who come during the rainy season will receive a share of the rainy season robes” is understood.

original: dbyar gyi dus la shin tu mang ba nyid ni de'i rnyed pa'i dus so //
analyzed: dbyar gyi dus la shin tu mang ba nyid ni de'i rnyed pa'i dus so //
translated: The rainy season is the time for receiving the rainy season robes.

original: gal te dbyar gyi nang du 'ongs pa la shin tu mang bar dbyar gnas la der gnas pa grub par 'gyur na de 'os pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te dbyar gyi nang du 'ongs pa la shin tu mang bar dbyar gnas la der gnas pa grub par 'gyur na de 'os pa yin no //
translated: If those who come during the rainy season receive a large share of the rainy season robes, then it is appropriate that they stay there.

original: dbyar ral ba la yang dbyar gyi rnyed pa'i skal ba dbang ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dbyar ral ba la yang dbyar gyi rnyed pa'i skal ba dbang ba'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the phrase “those who tear the rainy season retreat also receive a share of the rainy season robes” is that they receive a share of the rainy season robes.

original: 'dir rnyed pa dbang ba'i rgyu ni gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir rnyed pa dbang ba'i rgyu ni gnas pa yin te /
translated: Here, the cause of the right to receive is the status of a monk.

original: gnas par khas blangs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gnas par khas blangs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the status of one who has taken the vow.

original: ji ltar yang de ltar khas blangs kyang zhes bya ba de ltar @249a * //
analyzed: ji ltar yang de ltar khas blangs kyang zhes bya ba de ltar @249a * //
translated: Even though one has taken the vow,

original: rnam par gzhag pa 'di'o //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa 'di'o //
translated: this is the rule.🔽It is not right to give work to one who does not receive,

original: za zhing rnyed pa ma yin pa la ni las mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni zas tsam gyis 'tsho zhing rnyed pa ma yin pa la ni de la sus kyang bsko bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: za zhing rnyed pa ma yin pa la ni las mi rigs so zhes bya ba ni zas tsam gyis 'tsho zhing rnyed pa ma yin pa la ni de la sus kyang bsko bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: meaning that one who lives on just food should not be appointed to that.

original: 'dir gzhung ni kha cig las dbyar gyi nang du 'ongs pa dag gi dbang du byas te gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni kha cig las dbyar gyi nang du 'ongs pa dag gi dbang du byas te gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text is stated from the perspective of those who come during the rainy season.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag gi rnyed pa ma thob pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag gi rnyed pa ma thob pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: Here, the text is stated from the perspective of monks who have not received the right to receive.

original: gal te las su bskos pa byed na ni rnyed pa yang sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te las su bskos pa byed na ni rnyed pa yang sbyin par bya'o //
translated: The Blessed One said, “If one who has been appointed to work does the work, he should be given the right to receive.”

original: ji ste mi byang na ni zan la bltas pa tsam gyis gnas par bya ste las dang rnyed pa yang ngo zhes gsungs pa 'di la rigs pas bye brag nye bar bsdus nas mdo 'di gnyis kyis 'di bsdus so //
analyzed: ji ste mi byang na ni zan la bltas pa tsam gyis gnas par bya ste las dang rnyed pa yang ngo zhes gsungs pa 'di la rigs pas bye brag nye bar bsdus nas mdo 'di gnyis kyis 'di bsdus so //
translated: This is the meaning of the sutra.

original: gzhung gzhan las kyang dge slong dag zas kyi rnyed pa de yang mi nod nas /
analyzed: gzhung gzhan las kyang dge slong dag zas kyi rnyed pa de yang mi nod nas /
translated: In another text, the Buddha said, “Monks, if you do not accept that food,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: the Blessed One said,🔽‘You should give that food to those who are sick.’

original: de dag la zas kyi rnyed pa de dag sbyin par bya'o zhes gsungs pa de dag 'dir bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag la zas kyi rnyed pa de dag sbyin par bya'o zhes gsungs pa de dag 'dir bsdus pa yin no //
translated: This is included here.

original: las su ni gzhon rims nas mthar gyis bsko'o zhes bya ba ni gzhon rims nas mthar gyis bya'o //
analyzed: las su ni gzhon rims nas mthar gyis bsko'o zhes bya ba ni gzhon rims nas mthar gyis bya'o //
translated: As for work, the youngest should be appointed first, and so on.

original: rnyed pa mi 'thob pa la zas sbyin par bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni gang la dbyar ram dus gzhan la dbyar gyi dus bzhin du nges pa nyid kyi phyir //
analyzed: rnyed pa mi 'thob pa la zas sbyin par bya ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni gang la dbyar ram dus gzhan la dbyar gyi dus bzhin du nges pa nyid kyi phyir //
translated: As for giving food to those who do not obtain alms, this refers to those who are certain to be like the monks in the rainy season, or at other times, when they do not obtain alms.

original: bya bas rnyed pa mi 'thob pa de la zas ni sbyin par bya ba nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: bya bas rnyed pa mi 'thob pa de la zas ni sbyin par bya ba nyid yin pa'o //
translated: Food should be given to one who does not obtain it by his own actions.

original: gzhan gyi rnyed pa la 'du bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang zhig de'i tshe ma sbyin par len pa skyed pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rnyed pa la 'du bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang zhig de'i tshe ma sbyin par len pa skyed pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: One should not gather for the gains of others.

original: gnas gzhan mngon sum du rnyed pa'i phyir nang du gtogs pa'i khrod du zhugs nas zos na nyes par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gnas gzhan mngon sum du rnyed pa'i phyir nang du gtogs pa'i khrod du zhugs nas zos na nyes par 'gyur la /
translated: If one enters the inner circle and eats, there is an offense, because one has obtained a place to stay.

original: nyes pa med pa de'i don kho nar der song ba ma yin pa gtsug lag khang gzhan du song nas zos pa la'o //
analyzed: nyes pa med pa de'i don kho nar der song ba ma yin pa gtsug lag khang gzhan du song nas zos pa la'o //
translated: If one goes to another monastery and eats, there is no offense, because one has not gone there for that purpose.

original: gal te zas kyi don kho nar der song ba ma yin pa de la ni nyes pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gal te zas kyi don kho nar der song ba ma yin pa de la ni nyes pa med pa'o //
translated: If one has not gone there for the purpose of food, there is no offense.

original: mu ge'i tshe rang gis ma khyer ba la yang ngo zhes bya ba mu ge'i dus kyi tshe rang gis gtsug lag khang nas brgyags ma khyer bar gtsug lag khang gzhan du zan zos na nyes pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mu ge'i tshe rang gis ma khyer ba la yang ngo zhes bya ba mu ge'i dus kyi tshe rang gis gtsug lag khang nas brgyags ma khyer bar gtsug lag khang gzhan du zan zos na nyes pa med pa'o //
translated: If one eats in another monastery without taking food from one’s own monastery, there is no offense, even if one has not taken food from one’s own monastery.

original: dge slong gi tshang nyid las lhag ma nyid blangs pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang na gnas nas dge slong ji snyed pa 'khod pa'i zas kyi tshod las lhag pa'i @249b thob pa yod pa nyid yin na gtsug lag khang na gnas nas zas
analyzed: dge slong gi tshang nyid las lhag ma nyid blangs pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang na gnas nas dge slong ji snyed pa 'khod pa'i zas kyi tshod las lhag pa'i @249b thob pa yod pa nyid yin na gtsug lag khang na gnas nas zas
translated: Also, it is said that if the monk himself takes more than his share, there is no offense if he takes more than his share of food for the monks who are staying in the monastery.

original: blangs na nyes pa med pa'o //
analyzed: blangs na nyes pa med pa'o //
translated: If he takes food for the monks who are staying in the monastery, there is no offense.

original: gtsug lag khang yal bar mi dor ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ni sil bu dag las so //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang yal bar mi dor ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ni sil bu dag las so //
translated: One should not neglect the monastery means this is from the scattered texts.

original: rang gis zhes bya ba de yang ngo //
analyzed: rang gis zhes bya ba de yang ngo //
translated: Also, by oneself means that.

original: sbyin pa'i bdag po zhes bya ba de ni 'dir yang ngo //🔽phyir bcos pa'i phyir sbyin bdag spro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu ma smos pas gnas pa'i gzhi nyi tsher ma zad kyi dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang thams cad kyang dge 'dun gyi yin gyi gzhan gyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di'i
analyzed: sbyin pa'i bdag po zhes bya ba de ni 'dir yang ngo // phyir bcos pa'i phyir sbyin bdag spro bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu ma smos pas gnas pa'i gzhi nyi tsher ma zad kyi dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang thams cad kyang dge 'dun gyi yin gyi gzhan gyi ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di'i
translated: The benefactor means that here too.

original: 'og nas ston pa las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'og nas ston pa las shes par bya'o //
translated: In order to restore it, the benefactor should be encouraged means that not only the limited basis of the monastery, but also all the monasteries of the Saṅgha belong to the Saṅgha, and not to others. This should be understood from the teaching below.

original: ma grub na dge 'dun gyi las ji tsam gyis nus pa nges par sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni sbyin bdag ma grub na phyir bcos pa'i phyir dge 'dun gyi rdzas las ji tsam gyis chog par phyir bcos par bya'o //
analyzed: ma grub na dge 'dun gyi las ji tsam gyis nus pa nges par sbyar ro zhes bya ba ni sbyin bdag ma grub na phyir bcos pa'i phyir dge 'dun gyi rdzas las ji tsam gyis chog par phyir bcos par bya'o //
translated: If the donor is not available, the Saṅgha should restore the property to the extent that is necessary.🔽And one should restore it oneself.

original: rang gis kyang phyir bcos par bya'o zhes bya ba ni lag gi las kyi tshul gyis ci nus pas kyang ngo //
analyzed: rang gis kyang phyir bcos par bya'o zhes bya ba ni lag gi las kyi tshul gyis ci nus pas kyang ngo //
translated: One should also do what one can with one’s own hands.🔽The property should be used to clean the monastery.

original: rnyed pa mnod pas gtsug lag khang gi byi dor bya'o zhes bya ba ni de nas gang rnyed pa nod pa des las de bya'o //🔽dad pa'i rnyed pa ni gtsug lag khang nyid kyis ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dad pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i rnyed pa gang yin pa sbyin bdag dad pas dus nges pa med par gang zag 'ga' zhig la 'bul bar byed pa de ni gtsug lag khang
analyzed: rnyed pa mnod pas gtsug lag khang gi byi dor bya'o zhes bya ba ni de nas gang rnyed pa nod pa des las de bya'o // dad pa'i rnyed pa ni gtsug lag khang nyid kyis ma yin no zhes bya ba ni dad pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i rnyed pa gang yin pa sbyin bdag dad pas dus nges pa med par gang zag 'ga' zhig la 'bul bar byed pa de ni gtsug lag khang
translated: The property that is received should be used for that work.🔽Faith-based property does not belong to the monastery.

original: nyid la rnyed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nyid la rnyed pa ma yin no //
translated: Faith-based property is not the property of the monastery.

original: gtsug lag khang nas sgo bcad de 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang nas sgo bcad de 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: One should leave the monastery after closing the door.

original: srung ma yang gzhag ste'o zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang gi zhes bya ba'i lhag ma'o //
analyzed: srung ma yang gzhag ste'o zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang gi zhes bya ba'i lhag ma'o //
translated: And one should appoint a caretaker.

original: de la zan med na sbyin no zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang gi srung ma de la zan med na sbyin par bya'o //🔽des chom rkun pa'i rang dbang nyid med par mi shes par sgo dbye bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang gi srung ma des gzhan dag gtsug lag khang gi sgo phye shig ces zer na /
analyzed: de la zan med na sbyin no zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang gi srung ma de la zan med na sbyin par bya'o // des chom rkun pa'i rang dbang nyid med par mi shes par sgo dbye bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang gi srung ma des gzhan dag gtsug lag khang gi sgo phye shig ces zer na /
translated: The caretaker of the monastery should be given food if he has none.🔽If the caretaker of the monastery says to others, “Open the door of the monastery,”

original: chom rkun pa'i rang dbang nyid med pa nges par mi shes par sgo dbye bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: chom rkun pa'i rang dbang nyid med pa nges par mi shes par sgo dbye bar mi bya'o //
translated: he should not open the door unless he is certain that the thieves have no freedom of action.

original: 'dir nges par shes par bya ba'i thabs gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir nges par shes par bya ba'i thabs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the method for being certain in this case?

original: de'i phyir khang steng du 'dzegs la blta ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir khang steng du 'dzegs la blta ste /
translated: Therefore, one should climb to the top of the building and look.

original: khyod rims kyis ma btab bam zhes brjod pa ni 'dir thabs yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: khyod rims kyis ma btab bam zhes brjod pa ni 'dir thabs yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The statement, “You are not infected with the plague,” is the method in this case.

original: khyod rims kyis ma btab bam zhes brda skad brjod pa ni smrar gzhug pa'o //🔽gnas dang ming dang pha ma la sogs pa so sor @250a * //
analyzed: khyod rims kyis ma btab bam zhes brda skad brjod pa ni smrar gzhug pa'o // gnas dang ming dang pha ma la sogs pa so sor @250a * //
translated: The expression Are you not afflicted with a contagious disease? is the question.🔽The expression You should know your place, your name, your father, etc. is the answer.

original: shes par byed du gzhug pa yang ngo zhes bya ba yang brjod pa ni thabs yin no //
analyzed: shes par byed du gzhug pa yang ngo zhes bya ba yang brjod pa ni thabs yin no //
translated: The expression You should answer is the method.

original: 'di rjod par byed du gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rjod par byed du gzhug pa'o //
translated: This is the answer.

original: yid ma ches shing 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid la sgo dbye bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: yid ma ches shing 'jigs pa dang bcas pa nyid la sgo dbye bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not open the door to one who is not known and who is fearful.

original: dgon pa bas khyi bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dgon pa bas khyi bcang bar bya'o //
translated: The forest-dweller should keep a dog.

original: des nang bar sngar langs ma thag kho nar gtsug lag khang dang mchod rten gyi 'khor sa blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: des nang bar sngar langs ma thag kho nar gtsug lag khang dang mchod rten gyi 'khor sa blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: Immediately upon rising in the morning, he should first look at the monastery and the stupa.

original: des zhes bya ba ni khyi 'chang ba pos so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni khyi 'chang ba pos so //
translated: The expression he refers to the one who keeps the dog.

original: langs ma thag ces bya ba la langs ma thag kho nar zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bya ba gzhan dag ma byas pa'i mdun rol du blta bar bya'o zhes bstan pas ni nyi ma shar bar langs pa 'dis bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: langs ma thag ces bya ba la langs ma thag kho nar zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bya ba gzhan dag ma byas pa'i mdun rol du blta bar bya'o zhes bstan pas ni nyi ma shar bar langs pa 'dis bkag pa yin no //
translated: As soon as he gets up means that the word “as soon as” indicates that he should look before doing any other activity.

original: gal te des bshang ba byas na dor bar bya zhing gci ba byas na phyi bar bya /
analyzed: gal te des bshang ba byas na dor bar bya zhing gci ba byas na phyi bar bya /
translated: If he defecates, he should discard it. If he urinates, he should clean it up.

original: gal te sder mo dag gis brad na mnyam par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te sder mo dag gis brad na mnyam par bya'o //
translated: If he scratches with his claws, he should smooth it out.

original: de dag gi gnas dag tu dkyil 'khor bya'o zhes bya ba ni bshang ba la sogs pa de dag gi gnas dag tu bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi gnas dag tu dkyil 'khor bya'o zhes bya ba ni bshang ba la sogs pa de dag gi gnas dag tu bya'o //
translated: He should make a mandala in their places means that he should make a mandala in the places where they defecate, etc.

original: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is what is meant.

original: de ji ltar gso bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar gso bar bya zhe na /
translated: How should he feed them?

original: de'i phyir de la lhung bzed kyi lhag rol sbyin no zhes bya ba smos te khyi de la'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la lhung bzed kyi lhag rol sbyin no zhes bya ba smos te khyi de la'o //
translated: Therefore it says, “He should give them the leftovers from his begging bowl.”

original: gang du de sbyin par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang du de sbyin par bya zhe na /
translated: Where should he give it to them?

original: de'i phyir mchod rten dang gtsug lag khang gi nyen kor gyi phyi rol du'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mchod rten dang gtsug lag khang gi nyen kor gyi phyi rol du'o //
translated: Therefore it says, “Outside the precincts of the stūpa and the monastery.”

original: spyod lam ci 'dod pas lung dpog go zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: spyod lam ci 'dod pas lung dpog go zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should receive the scriptures in whatever posture one likes.

original: lung dbog pa ni spyod lam bzhi po dag las ci 'dod bas dbog na yang de la nyes pa med pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: lung dbog pa ni spyod lam bzhi po dag las ci 'dod bas dbog na yang de la nyes pa med pa'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is no fault if one receives the scriptures in any of the four postures, or in whatever posture one likes.

original: gsar bus mnod pa'i phyir khams snyoms pa nyid dri ste /
analyzed: gsar bus mnod pa'i phyir khams snyoms pa nyid dri ste /
translated: One should ask about the elements in order to be harmonious with the new student.

original: phyag bya ba sngar btang ba'i spyod lam bsten par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsar bus bla ma la klag pa'i lung mnod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyag bya ba sngar btang ba'i spyod lam bsten par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsar bus bla ma la klag pa'i lung mnod pa'i phyir /
translated: One should adopt the conduct of first making prostrations and inquiring after well-being for the sake of the new student who is receiving the reading transmission from the guru.

original: sngar phyag bya ste bsnyun gsol nas bya ba'i spyod lam bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: sngar phyag bya ste bsnyun gsol nas bya ba'i spyod lam bsten par bya'o //
translated: One should adopt the conduct of first making prostrations and inquiring after well-being.

original: rgan pas ni phyag mi bya bar bsnyun gsol nas so //
analyzed: rgan pas ni phyag mi bya bar bsnyun gsol nas so //
translated: For the elder, one should not make prostrations but inquire after well-being.

original: thal mo bsnol te bcang ngo zhes bya ba ni lag pa gnyis kyis thal mo bsnol te bcang ba'i spyod lam bsten par bya'o ;
analyzed: thal mo bsnol te bcang ngo zhes bya ba ni lag pa gnyis kyis thal mo bsnol te bcang ba'i spyod lam bsten par bya'o ;
translated: One should hold the palms together means one should adopt the conduct of holding the palms together with both hands.

original: / lus dang sems btud do zhes bya ba ni lus btud pa dang sems btud par bya ba ste /
analyzed: / lus dang sems btud do zhes bya ba ni lus btud pa dang sems btud par bya ba ste /
translated: One should bow with body and mind means one should bow with the body and bow with the mind.

original: nga rgyal gyis sems khengs pa'i yan lag kyang sems dma' ba nyid yin la gus pa dang bcas pa nyid kyang sems dma' ba nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis sems khengs pa'i yan lag kyang sems dma' ba nyid yin la gus pa dang bcas pa nyid kyang sems dma' ba nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The limb of pride that fills the mind should be known as the very humility of mind that is accompanied by respect.

original: drang por ro zhes bya ba ni gya gyu med pa @250b dang sgyu dang g-yo med par bya'o //
analyzed: drang por ro zhes bya ba ni gya gyu med pa @250b dang sgyu dang g-yo med par bya'o //
translated: Straight means without crookedness, without deceit, and without guile.

original: lung 'bogs par byed pa gnas ji lta bu de lta bur gyur pa'i spyod lam bsten par bya zhe na /
analyzed: lung 'bogs par byed pa gnas ji lta bu de lta bur gyur pa'i spyod lam bsten par bya zhe na /
translated: In what manner should one who is giving instruction adopt the proper deportment?

original: de'i phyir 'chag pa na gom pa sri bas bcag pa'i 'o zhes bya ba smos te /🔽lung 'bogs par byed pa 'chag pa na lung nod par byed pas gom pa sri bar bcag pa'i spyod lam bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'chag pa na gom pa sri bas bcag pa'i 'o zhes bya ba smos te / lung 'bogs par byed pa 'chag pa na lung nod par byed pas gom pa sri bar bcag pa'i spyod lam bsten par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said, When walking, one should adopt the deportment of one who is walking slowly, with small steps.🔽 When one who is giving instruction is walking, one who is receiving instruction should adopt the deportment of one who is walking slowly, with small steps.

original: 'greng ba dang 'greng ba'i 'o zhes bya ba ni lung 'bogs par byed pa 'greng ba na lung nod par byed pas kyang 'greng ba'i spyod lam bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: 'greng ba dang 'greng ba'i 'o zhes bya ba ni lung 'bogs par byed pa 'greng ba na lung nod par byed pas kyang 'greng ba'i spyod lam bsten par bya'o //
translated: When standing, one should adopt the deportment of one who is standing. When one who is giving instruction is standing, one who is receiving instruction should adopt the deportment of one who is standing.

original: 'dug pa dang nyal ba na 'dug pa'i 'o zhes bya ba ni bsten par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dug pa dang nyal ba na 'dug pa'i 'o zhes bya ba ni bsten par bya'o //
translated: When sitting or lying down, one should sit.

original: gang du 'dug pa'i spyod lam bsten par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang du 'dug pa'i spyod lam bsten par bya zhe na /
translated: In what posture should one sit?

original: de'i phyir stan ches dma' ba la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir stan ches dma' ba la'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said: on a very low seat.

original: 'dir ches rgan pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir ches rgan pa ni /
translated: Here, one who is very old

original: rjes su gnang ba la mi ltos pa nyid kyis rang 'dug par bya'o //
analyzed: rjes su gnang ba la mi ltos pa nyid kyis rang 'dug par bya'o //
translated: should sit by oneself without regard for permission.

original: gsar bus rjes su gnang ba la ltos te 'dug par bya ba bstan pa'i phyir gsar bus ni bsgo na'o zhes bya ba smos te lung 'bogs par byed pas bsgo zhing rjes su gnang na 'dug par bya'o //
analyzed: gsar bus rjes su gnang ba la ltos te 'dug par bya ba bstan pa'i phyir gsar bus ni bsgo na'o zhes bya ba smos te lung 'bogs par byed pas bsgo zhing rjes su gnang na 'dug par bya'o //
translated: In order to show that a novice should sit with regard for permission, it is said: a novice should sit when permitted by the preceptor.

original: ma bsgo ba'i chog bstan pa'i phyir /🔽ma bsgo na tsog pus so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ma bsgo ba'i chog bstan pa'i phyir / ma bsgo na tsog pus so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to show the propriety of not being permitted,🔽it is said: if not permitted, one should sit squatting.

original: 'dug pa bsten par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dug pa bsten par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: One should sit in the posture of squatting.

original: mnod par bya ba mang ba nyid yin na zhu bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni lung mnod par bya ba'i gzhung mang ba nyid yin na 'dug pa'i phyir lung 'bogs par byed pa la zhu bar bya'o //
analyzed: mnod par bya ba mang ba nyid yin na zhu bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni lung mnod par bya ba'i gzhung mang ba nyid yin na 'dug pa'i phyir lung 'bogs par byed pa la zhu bar bya'o //
translated: The text here states: If the text to be recited is long, one should request the recitation from the instructor.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gal te gsar bus yin la /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gal te gsar bus yin la /
translated: If it is short, one should recite it oneself.🔽If the text to be recited is short, one should recite it oneself, sitting on a seat lower than that of the instructor.

original: mang du nod na slob dpon la zhus te stan ches dma' ba la 'dug nas lung mnod par bya'o //
analyzed: mang du nod na slob dpon la zhus te stan ches dma' ba la 'dug nas lung mnod par bya'o //
translated: If it is long, one should request the recitation from the instructor, sitting on a very low seat.

original: ji ste nyung du nod na ni tsog bus 'dug ste'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ste nyung du nod na ni tsog bus 'dug ste'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If one is reciting a short text, one should do so squatting.

original: thos pa'i nyen kor ma gtogs pa snang ba'i nyen kor du 'dug ste kha ton bya'o zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i nyen kor du gnas nas so //
analyzed: thos pa'i nyen kor ma gtogs pa snang ba'i nyen kor du 'dug ste kha ton bya'o zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i nyen kor du gnas nas so //
translated: One should recite the text while sitting in the light of the teacher, except when one is in the vicinity of the teacher.

original: gdams ngag ni mtha' gcig tu song ste bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgom pa'i gdams dag go //
analyzed: gdams ngag ni mtha' gcig tu song ste bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgom pa'i gdams dag go //
translated: One should practice the instructions after going to a secluded place.

original: lung 'bogs pa dang mnod ba'i shin tu legs par bslabs pa dang / shin tu yongs su byang ba dang the tshom med par byas te'o //🔽gnas khang dang zas la bsko ba dang thug pa dang bag chos dang shing thog 'drim pa bsko bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnas khang bsko bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: lung 'bogs pa dang mnod ba'i shin tu legs par bslabs pa dang / shin tu yongs su byang ba dang the tshom med par byas te'o // gnas khang dang zas la bsko ba dang thug pa dang bag chos dang shing thog 'drim pa bsko bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni gnas khang bsko bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: and they should be well trained in recitation and in the oral instructions, well purified, and free of doubt.🔽The appointment of those who distribute food, gruel, pastries, and fruit should be done.

original: @251a * // thug pa dang bag chos dang shing thog 'drim pa yang bsko bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgra dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: @251a * // thug pa dang bag chos dang shing thog 'drim pa yang bsko bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni sgra dang sbyar ro //
translated: The appointment of those who distribute food, gruel, pastries, and fruit should be done.

original: bar bur 'drim pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni bsko bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bar bur 'drim pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni bsko bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The appointment of those who distribute buttermilk should also be done.

original: gzhung kha cig las ni bar bur 'drim pa zhes bya ba 'di'i ming phran tshegs 'drim pa zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gzhung kha cig las ni bar bur 'drim pa zhes bya ba 'di'i ming phran tshegs 'drim pa zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: In some texts, the name of this is given as “distributor of miscellaneous items.”

original: bar bur zhes bya ba de ci yin zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: bar bur zhes bya ba de ci yin zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: What is buttermilk?

original: lhag rol phyi de nyin par brim par bya ba ni de zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lhag rol phyi de nyin par brim par bya ba ni de zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The remainder is to be distributed the next day.

original: 'dir gzhung ni bag chos la sogs pa brim pa'i lhag rol lus pas su yang brim par mi byed pa na /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni bag chos la sogs pa brim pa'i lhag rol lus pas su yang brim par mi byed pa na /
translated: Here, the text is: “When the remainder of the distribution of the rainy season robe-cloth, etc. is left over and no one distributes it,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: the Blessed One said:

original: bar bur brim pa bsko bar bya zhing des de dag phyi de nyin par brim par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bar bur brim pa bsko bar bya zhing des de dag phyi de nyin par brim par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: ‘Appoint a distributor, and he should distribute it the next day.’

original: snod spyad 'drub pa'o zhes bya ba ni bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: snod spyad 'drub pa'o zhes bya ba ni bsko bar bya'o //
translated: ‘The one who makes the bowls’ means he should be appointed.

original: dbyar gyi ras chen no zhes bya ba ni sbed pa po bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: dbyar gyi ras chen no zhes bya ba ni sbed pa po bsko bar bya'o //
translated: ‘The rainy season robe’ means the one who hides it should be appointed.

original: snam sbyar zhes bya ba ni 'di la dge 'dun gyi bsam par bya ba ma yin pa nyid shes pa'o ;
analyzed: snam sbyar zhes bya ba ni 'di la dge 'dun gyi bsam par bya ba ma yin pa nyid shes pa'o ;
translated: ‘The patched robe’ means he should know what is not to be done by the Saṅgha.

original: / chos gos bstan pa'o zhes bya ba ni sbed pa po bsko bar bya'o //🔽gang zhig 'di gding ba po bstan pa ste /
analyzed: / chos gos bstan pa'o zhes bya ba ni sbed pa po bsko bar bya'o // gang zhig 'di gding ba po bstan pa ste /
translated: ‘The teaching of the Dharma robe’ means the one who hides it should be appointed.🔽‘The one who spreads it out’ is taught here.

original: 'dir sbed pa'o zhes bya bar rjod pa po rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir sbed pa'o zhes bya bar rjod pa po rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Here, the one who hides it is the one who is called the one who is established.

original: gos dag go zhes bya ba ni sbed pa po bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: gos dag go zhes bya ba ni sbed pa po bsko bar bya'o //
translated: “The one who hides the robes” means the one who is appointed to hide the robes.

original: 'gyed pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni gos sbed pa dang 'gyed pa po de gnyis bsko bar bya'o //🔽dge skos dang mngag gzhug go zhes bya ba ni skos ci rigs par sbyar ba'i phyir bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyed pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni gos sbed pa dang 'gyed pa po de gnyis bsko bar bya'o // dge skos dang mngag gzhug go zhes bya ba ni skos ci rigs par sbyar ba'i phyir bsdus pa'o //
translated: “The one who distributes” means the one who is appointed to hide the robes and distribute them.🔽“The one who assigns work and the one who is appointed to a service” means the one who assigns work and the one who is appointed to a service.

original: dge skos kyi bya ba dang bag yangs su gyur pa dang des bya ba gang yin pa des de 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge skos kyi bya ba dang bag yangs su gyur pa dang des bya ba gang yin pa des de 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The one who assigns work is appointed to do the work of the saṅgha, and the one who is appointed to a service is appointed to do the work of the saṅgha.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong rnams kyi zan gyi gral dang chos nyan sar su yang stan shom par mi byed nas /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong rnams kyi zan gyi gral dang chos nyan sar su yang stan shom par mi byed nas /
translated: Here is the text: No one should set out seats in the row for the meal of the monks or in the place for listening to the Dharma.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: dge skos bsko bar bya zhing dge skos kyis kun du spyod pa thams cad bya'o //
analyzed: dge skos bsko bar bya zhing dge skos kyis kun du spyod pa thams cad bya'o //
translated: “Appoint the one who assigns work. The one who assigns work should do all the activities of the saṅgha.

original: dge skos la bya ba cung zhig byung ba des su yang mi byed nas /
analyzed: dge skos la bya ba cung zhig byung ba des su yang mi byed nas /
translated: If the one who assigns work has some work to do, no one else should do it.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: mngag gzhug bsko bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mngag gzhug bsko bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Appoint the one who is appointed to a service.”

original: sder spyad 'drim mo zhes bya ba ni bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: sder spyad 'drim mo zhes bya ba ni bsko bar bya'o //
translated: The one who distributes the eating bowls is the one who is appointed to distribute the bowls.🔽When they are distributed and the food is eaten, the one who collects them is the one who is appointed to collect the bowls.

original: de dag 'drim pa dang zan gyu nas sba ba ni de'i las yin no zhes bya ba ni dge slong des zan gyi don du sder spyad 'drim par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag 'drim pa dang zan gyu nas sba ba ni de'i las yin no zhes bya ba ni dge slong des zan gyi don du sder spyad 'drim par bya'o //
translated: The text says that the monk who is appointed to distribute the bowls should distribute the bowls for the sake of the food.

original: 'dir @251b gzhung ni sder spyad 'drim pa des dge slong rnams kyi zan gyi gral du sder dag brim par bya zhing zan zos zin nas brub par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir @251b gzhung ni sder spyad 'drim pa des dge slong rnams kyi zan gyi gral du sder dag brim par bya zhing zan zos zin nas brub par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the text says that the one who distributes the bowls should distribute the bowls in the row of monks who are eating, and should collect them after they have finished eating.

original: chu'i zhal ta pa'o zhes bya ba ni chu sbyin pa la de'i bya ba la bsko bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don gyis shes pa'o //
analyzed: chu'i zhal ta pa'o zhes bya ba ni chu sbyin pa la de'i bya ba la bsko bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don gyis shes pa'o //
translated: The one who serves water is understood to mean that the one who is appointed to give water is appointed to the task of serving water.

original: mdzes chos so zhes bya ba ni mdzes par bya ba'i don du 'chos pa ni mdzes chos kyi don du bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: mdzes chos so zhes bya ba ni mdzes par bya ba'i don du 'chos pa ni mdzes chos kyi don du bsko bar bya'o //
translated: The one who decorates is appointed to decorate for the sake of decoration.

original: de bltas te rab tu byung ba rnams mi mdzes pa bsten na se gol gyi sgra sngon du btang ste mdzes pa la nges par sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mdzes chos des so //
analyzed: de bltas te rab tu byung ba rnams mi mdzes pa bsten na se gol gyi sgra sngon du btang ste mdzes pa la nges par sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mdzes chos des so //
translated: If they are not beautiful, then they should be made beautiful by the sound of snapping the fingers, and then one should definitely apply the beautiful practices.

original: mdzes pa la nges par sbyar ba'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'dir lta ste /
analyzed: mdzes pa la nges par sbyar ba'i ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i phyir 'dir lta ste /
translated: In order to demonstrate the nature of definitely applying the beautiful practices, it says here:

original: zas la sgra bskyung ba nyid dang shin tu bsdams pa nyid dang shin tu nogs thug pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: zas la sgra bskyung ba nyid dang shin tu bsdams pa nyid dang shin tu nogs thug pa nyid kyis so //
translated: In regard to food, it is the quietness of sound, the extreme restraint, and the extreme slowness.

original: mchod rten la phyag bya ba la sgra bskyung ba nyid dang rgan rims nyid kyis so zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: mchod rten la phyag bya ba la sgra bskyung ba nyid dang rgan rims nyid kyis so zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In regard to paying homage to the stūpa, it is the quietness of sound and the seniority.

original: bang rim gyi zhal ta pa'o zhes bya ba ni bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: bang rim gyi zhal ta pa'o zhes bya ba ni bsko bar bya'o //
translated: The one who is appointed is the caretaker of the terrace.

original: des dang por zan zos te dbyi gu blangs nas zan za ba dag la khva ta dang bye'u dang phug ron la sogs pa dag bzlog par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bang rim gyi zhal ta ba des so //
analyzed: des dang por zan zos te dbyi gu blangs nas zan za ba dag la khva ta dang bye'u dang phug ron la sogs pa dag bzlog par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bang rim gyi zhal ta ba des so //
translated: First, he should eat, take the broom, and drive away the crows, birds, pigeons, and so forth that are eating the food. This is the caretaker of the terrace.

original: khva ta la sogs pa de dag ni bang rim la sogs pa dag tu gnas 'cha' bas de'i phyir des shas cher de dag zlog par byed pas bang rim gyi zhal ta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khva ta la sogs pa de dag ni bang rim la sogs pa dag tu gnas 'cha' bas de'i phyir des shas cher de dag zlog par byed pas bang rim gyi zhal ta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Those crows, etc. are called the “caretakers of the terraces” because they live on the terraces, etc. and therefore they mostly ward off those who would destroy the terraces.

original: gnas mal dbog pa dang gnas mal byi bo dbog pa'o zhes bya ba ni de gnyis dpog pa spro bar bya ste gcig gi dngos po'o //🔽gnas mal zhes bya ba ni khri dang khri'u la sogs pa la rtag par gnas pa la'o //🔽gnas mal byi bo zhes bya ba ni khri dang khri'u dang ; stan nang tshangs can dang mal cha dang stan dang gnas mal la sogs pa med pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnas mal dbog pa dang gnas mal byi bo dbog pa'o zhes bya ba ni de gnyis dpog pa spro bar bya ste gcig gi dngos po'o // gnas mal zhes bya ba ni khri dang khri'u la sogs pa la rtag par gnas pa la'o // gnas mal byi bo zhes bya ba ni khri dang khri'u dang ; stan nang tshangs can dang mal cha dang stan dang gnas mal la sogs pa med pa 'di lta ste /
translated: The “distributor of bedding” and the “distributor of bedding and seats” are the same person, but the duties are different.🔽“Bedding” means beds, benches, etc. that are always used.🔽“Seats” means seats, benches, cushions, bedding, etc. that are not always used.

original: shing ljon pa'i drung dang ne'u gsing la sogs pa gtan gyi gnas mal ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: shing ljon pa'i drung dang ne'u gsing la sogs pa gtan gyi gnas mal ma yin pa'o //
translated: “Bedding and seats” means not always used beds, benches, cushions, bedding, seats, etc. such as the foot of a tree, a grassy area, etc.

original: zas rung ba dang bcas pa nyid yin na mi dag 'ong ba la sge'u chung srung ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa zhugs nas zas rung ba dang bcas pa nyid ces bya ba sha dang bcas pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: zas rung ba dang bcas pa nyid yin na mi dag 'ong ba la sge'u chung srung ba'o zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa zhugs nas zas rung ba dang bcas pa nyid ces bya ba sha dang bcas pa nyid yin na /
translated: If it is suitable to eat, then it is suitable to have a guard at the window.

original: der mi gzhan dag 'ong ba dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: der mi gzhan dag 'ong ba dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: This means that if it is suitable to eat, then when other people come,

original: sge'u chung srung ba spro bar bya ste bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: sge'u chung srung ba spro bar bya ste bsko bar bya'o //
translated: one should appoint a guard at the window to prevent them.

original: 'dir sge'u chung zhes bya ba ni dgag pa sgo ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir sge'u chung zhes bya ba ni dgag pa sgo ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the window is to be understood as a door for prevention.🔽Here is the text:

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag @252a * //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag @252a * //
translated: Monks,

original: gral na zan za ba na mi dag 'ongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: gral na zan za ba na mi dag 'ongs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: when eating in a row, if people come, the Blessed One said:

original: sge'u chung srung ba bsko bar bya'o //
analyzed: sge'u chung srung ba bsko bar bya'o //
translated: Appoint a guard at the window.

original: sha dag 'drim pa na bram ze dang khyim bdag dag 'phya nas /
analyzed: sha dag 'drim pa na bram ze dang khyim bdag dag 'phya nas /
translated: When distributing meat, Brahmins and householders ridiculed them.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:🔽If it is suitable to eat, then it is suitable to have a guard at the window.

original: gang gi tshe rung ba yod pa de'i tshe sge'u chung srung ba bsko bar bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rung ba yod pa de'i tshe sge'u chung srung ba bsko bar bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: When there is a suitable person, then the window guard should be appointed.

original: gnas mal gyi gzhi'o /
analyzed: gnas mal gyi gzhi'o /
translated: This is the basis for assigning sleeping places.🔽One should say the words “I pay homage” in a dark place where one is not seen.

original: // / phyag bya ba'i gnas mun khrod du phyag dang bcas pa'i tshig brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni phyag 'tshal ba'i gnas mun khrod du dge slong gis phyag mi bya bar phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba'i sgra dang bcas pa'i tshig brjod par bya ba yin gyi
analyzed: // / phyag bya ba'i gnas mun khrod du phyag dang bcas pa'i tshig brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni phyag 'tshal ba'i gnas mun khrod du dge slong gis phyag mi bya bar phyag 'tshal lo zhes bya ba'i sgra dang bcas pa'i tshig brjod par bya ba yin gyi
translated: This means that a monk should not pay homage in a dark place where he is not seen, but should say the words “I pay homage” with the sound of paying homage.

original: zhes bya ba 'dir smos na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dir smos na /
translated: If this is said,

original: 'di ni phyag 'tshal ba'i tshe mdud pa med par 'di mi rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ni phyag 'tshal ba'i tshe mdud pa med par 'di mi rigs so zhe na /
translated: it is not proper to be without a bow when paying homage.

original: bden mod kyi de'i phyir 'dud pa dang bcas par zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: bden mod kyi de'i phyir 'dud pa dang bcas par zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: This is true, but for that reason “with a bow” is said.

original: nyen kor du gyur pa gzhan gyis phyag bya bar brtsams pa la phyag mi bya bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis phyag bya bar brtsams pa la nyen kor du gyur pa gzhan gyis phyag bya bar 'os pa la gzhan gyis phyag mi bya ba ma
analyzed: nyen kor du gyur pa gzhan gyis phyag bya bar brtsams pa la phyag mi bya bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis phyag bya bar brtsams pa la nyen kor du gyur pa gzhan gyis phyag bya bar 'os pa la gzhan gyis phyag mi bya ba ma
translated: One should not refuse to bow down to another who is worthy of salutation, when another has begun to bow down to him.

original: yin no // sil bu dag las 'di dang por byas nas phyag 'tshal ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: yin no // sil bu dag las 'di dang por byas nas phyag 'tshal ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'o //

original: 'dir zhu ba dag las /
analyzed: 'dir zhu ba dag las /
translated: Here, in the Questions of Upāli,

original: mtha' dang bcas pa la dor nas mi bya zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so //🔽tshangs pa'i phyag gis ni de byas pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa'i phyag ces bya ba thams cad la khyab pa thams cad gnas gcig tu tshogs pa la spyir phyag bya ba bstan phyag bya ba bstan pa ste de byas na de byas pa
analyzed: mtha' dang bcas pa la dor nas mi bya zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs so // tshangs pa'i phyag gis ni de byas pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa'i phyag ces bya ba thams cad la khyab pa thams cad gnas gcig tu tshogs pa la spyir phyag bya ba bstan phyag bya ba bstan pa ste de byas na de byas pa
translated: it says, “One should not abandon the one who has precepts.”🔽“The gesture of Brahmā” is the gesture of salutation, which is the gathering of all the limbs in one place.

original: nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyid yin pa'o //
translated: If one does that, it is as if one has done everything.

original: nang dang bcas pa la phyag mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nang dang bcas pa la phyag mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should not bow down to those who are accompanied by their retinue.

original: 'dir nang dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni gnod pa bya ba'i bsam pas nye bar gnas par bya ba yin par rig par bya'i /
analyzed: 'dir nang dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni gnod pa bya ba'i bsam pas nye bar gnas par bya ba yin par rig par bya'i /
translated: Here, “accompanied” means that they are accompanied by the intention to harm.

original: rtsod do cog thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtsod do cog thams cad ni ma yin no //

original: de bas na gnod par bya ba'i bsam pas nye bar gnas pa la phyag byad mi rung gi rtsod pa gzhan la ni rung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na gnod par bya ba'i bsam pas nye bar gnas pa la phyag byad mi rung gi rtsod pa gzhan la ni rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not proper to bow down to those who are accompanied by the intention to harm, but it is proper to bow down to those who are in dispute in other cases.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gnyis la phyag bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gnyis la phyag bya ste /
translated: Here, the text says that one should bow down to the two:

original: glo bur du 'ongs pa dag dang gnyug mar gnas pa dag gis phan tshun rgan rims bzhin du phyag bya'o //
analyzed: glo bur du 'ongs pa dag dang gnyug mar gnas pa dag gis phan tshun rgan rims bzhin du phyag bya'o //
translated: those who have come as guests and those who are permanent residents, as if they were one’s elders,

original: nang dang bcas pa dang yongs su gnas pa byed pa ni ma gtogs so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nang dang bcas pa dang yongs su gnas pa byed pa ni ma gtogs so zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: except for those who are accompanied by their retinue and those who are in charge of the monastery.

original: phyag 'tshal ba la aa rog gya zhes @252b bya bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal ba la aa rog gya zhes @252b bya bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not say “I pay homage” when bowing down.

original: 'das pa la phyag bya ba yin pa la phyag mi bya ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni sngon 'das pa'i dus na de phyag bya ba nyid du 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: 'das pa la phyag bya ba yin pa la phyag mi bya ba nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni sngon 'das pa'i dus na de phyag bya ba nyid du 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: It is not that he is not worthy of homage in the past.🔽He was worthy of homage in the past, but is not worthy of homage now.

original: da ltar phyag bya ba nyid ma yin du zin kyang sngon gyi gnas skabs de nyid mngon sum byas te phyag byar rung bas de'i phyir de la phyag bya ba nyid yin no//
analyzed: da ltar phyag bya ba nyid ma yin du zin kyang sngon gyi gnas skabs de nyid mngon sum byas te phyag byar rung bas de'i phyir de la phyag bya ba nyid yin no//
translated: However, since he is suitable to be worshipped by manifesting that very former state, he is worthy of homage.

original: 'di ni dge slong rgan po khros pa'i dbang gis sdom pa rgyun chad de sprul du gyur pa la /
analyzed: 'di ni dge slong rgan po khros pa'i dbang gis sdom pa rgyun chad de sprul du gyur pa la /
translated: This is the nidana for the elder monk who, due to anger, broke his vows and was reborn as a snake.

original: dge slong cig shos kyis sngon gyi rgyud de mngon sum du bya ste 'dud par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i gleng gzhi yin te /
analyzed: dge slong cig shos kyis sngon gyi rgyud de mngon sum du bya ste 'dud par bya'o zhes gsungs pa'i gleng gzhi yin te /
translated: The other monk manifested his former continuum and bowed down to him.

original: thams cad la bye brag med pas byar rung bas 'dir spyir mdor byas so //🔽sbags pa la phyag mi bya'o //
analyzed: thams cad la bye brag med pas byar rung bas 'dir spyir mdor byas so // sbags pa la phyag mi bya'o //
translated: Since he is suitable to be worshipped without distinction, he is generally included here.🔽One should not bow to one who is defiled.

original: sbags pas phyag mi bya'o //
analyzed: sbags pas phyag mi bya'o //
translated: One should not bow to one who is defiled.

original: des bdag gir mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbags pa la phyag mi bya ba dang / sbags pas gzhan la phyag mi bya ba dang / sbags pas phyag de bdag gir mi bya'o //
analyzed: des bdag gir mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbags pa la phyag mi bya ba dang / sbags pas gzhan la phyag mi bya ba dang / sbags pas phyag de bdag gir mi bya'o //
translated: One should not receive prostrations from a defiled person, nor should one receive prostrations from another through a defiled person, nor should one receive prostrations from a defiled person.

original: sbags pa las mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbags pa gzhan las phyag de bdag gir mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: sbags pa las mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbags pa gzhan las phyag de bdag gir mi bya ba'o //
translated: One should not receive prostrations from another through a defiled person.

original: 'dir gzhung ni bcom ldan 'das kyis nad pa blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / nad pa blta bar bya ba'i dge slong rgan po dag dang gsar bu dag kyang dong nas /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni bcom ldan 'das kyis nad pa blta bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang / nad pa blta bar bya ba'i dge slong rgan po dag dang gsar bu dag kyang dong nas /
translated: Here, the text is as follows: The Blessed One said, “You should visit the sick.” Monks, both the elders and the novices, went to visit the sick.

original: de na gsar bu gang dag yin pa de dag ni nad pa de la phyag 'tshal bar byed /
analyzed: de na gsar bu gang dag yin pa de dag ni nad pa de la phyag 'tshal bar byed /
translated: Among them, the novices paid homage to the sick person.

original: rgan po gang dag yin pa de dag la ni nad pa des phyag dag 'tshal bar byed pa na de skyo bar gyur nas /
analyzed: rgan po gang dag yin pa de dag la ni nad pa des phyag dag 'tshal bar byed pa na de skyo bar gyur nas /
translated: When the sick person paid homage to the elders, he became weary.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽sbags pa la phyag mi bya'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / sbags pa la phyag mi bya'o //
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sbags pas phyag mi bya'o //
analyzed: sbags pas phyag mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not receive prostrations from a defiled person.🔽One should not receive prostrations from another through a defiled person.

original: sbags pas phyag bdag gir mi bya'o //
analyzed: sbags pas phyag bdag gir mi bya'o //
translated: One should not make obeisance to one who is defiled, nor should one make obeisance to one who is making obeisance to another.🔽One should not make obeisance to one who is defiled, nor should one make obeisance to one who is making obeisance to another.

original: sbags pa las phyag bdag gir mi bya'o //🔽sbags pa la phyag 'tshal lam /🔽sbags pas phyag 'tshal lam /🔽sbags pas phyag bdag gir byed dam /
analyzed: sbags pa las phyag bdag gir mi bya'o // sbags pa la phyag 'tshal lam / sbags pas phyag 'tshal lam / sbags pas phyag bdag gir byed dam /
translated: One should not make obeisance to one who is defiled, nor should one make obeisance to one who is making obeisance to another.🔽One should not make obeisance to one who is defiled, nor should one make obeisance to one who is making obeisance to another.🔽One should not make obeisance to one who is defiled, nor should one make obeisance to one who is making obeisance to another.

original: sbags pa las phyag bdag gir byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sbags pa las phyag bdag gir byed na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: One should not make obeisance to one who is defiled, nor should one make obeisance to one who is making obeisance to another.

original: sbags pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sbags pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Defilement is of two kinds:

original: tha na so shing yan chad za bas sam /
analyzed: tha na so shing yan chad za bas sam /
translated: defilement by eating, even if it is just a tooth stick;🔽defilement by impurity, even if it is just the cleaning of the ground.

original: tha na de'i sa byi dor byed pa yan chad mi gtsang bas so zhes bya ba ni za bas sbags pa ni tha na so shing yan chad za bas sbags pa yin no //
analyzed: tha na de'i sa byi dor byed pa yan chad mi gtsang bas so zhes bya ba ni za bas sbags pa ni tha na so shing yan chad za bas sbags pa yin no //
translated: Defilement by eating is even if it is just a tooth stick.

original: mi gtsang bas sbags pa ni tha na mi gtsang ba'i sa byi dor byed pa yan chad gyis sbags pa yin no //
analyzed: mi gtsang bas sbags pa ni tha na mi gtsang ba'i sa byi dor byed pa yan chad gyis sbags pa yin no //
translated: Defilement by impurity is even if it is just the cleaning of the ground.

original: 'di la gcer bu nyid dang gos gcig pa nyid ni sbags pa dang @253a * //
analyzed: 'di la gcer bu nyid dang gos gcig pa nyid ni sbags pa dang @253a * //
translated: Here, nakedness and wearing only one garment are like defilement.

original: 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni 'di la zhes bya ba ni phyag bya ba la ste /
analyzed: 'dra'o zhes bya ba ni 'di la zhes bya ba ni phyag bya ba la ste /
translated: Here means in making obeisance.

original: des gcer bu la phyag mi bya'o //
analyzed: des gcer bu la phyag mi bya'o //
translated: One should not bow to a naked ascetic.

original: gcer bus phyag mi bya'o //🔽gcer bus phyag bdag gir mi bya'o //
analyzed: gcer bus phyag mi bya'o // gcer bus phyag bdag gir mi bya'o //
translated: A naked ascetic should not bow.🔽A naked ascetic should not bow to oneself.

original: gcer bu las phyag bdag gir mi bya'o //
analyzed: gcer bu las phyag bdag gir mi bya'o //
translated: One should not bow to a naked ascetic.

original: de bzhin du gos gcig pa la phyag mi bya'o //🔽gcig pas phyag mi bya'o //🔽gos gcig pas phyag bdag gir mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gos gcig pa la phyag mi bya'o // gcig pas phyag mi bya'o // gos gcig pas phyag bdag gir mi bya'o //
translated: Similarly, one should not bow to one wearing a single piece of cloth.🔽One wearing a single piece of cloth should not bow.🔽One wearing a single piece of cloth should not bow to oneself.

original: gos gcig pa las phyag bdag gir mi bya'o //
analyzed: gos gcig pa las phyag bdag gir mi bya'o //
translated: One should not bow to one wearing a single piece of cloth.

original: phyag ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: phyag ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of prostration:

original: yan lag lngas phyag 'tshal ba dang / sgyid pa la 'khyud pas phyag 'tshal ba'o //
analyzed: yan lag lngas phyag 'tshal ba dang / sgyid pa la 'khyud pas phyag 'tshal ba'o //
translated: prostration with five limbs and prostration with the body bent.

original: sbrid ba byung ba la sos zhes brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: sbrid ba byung ba la sos zhes brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: When one is yawning, one should not say “Ah, yawn!”

original: rgan zhugs dang khyim pa la ni ma gtogs so //🔽gsar bu de la aa rog gya zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rgan zhugs dang khyim pa la ni ma gtogs so // gsar bu de la aa rog gya zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Except for a novice and a layperson.🔽To a young man one should say “Ah, yawn!”🔽To an elder one should say “Prostrate!”

original: rgan po la ni phyag bya'o zhes bya ba ni de la zhes bya ni sbrid pa byung ba de la ni gsar bus phyag bya'o //
analyzed: rgan po la ni phyag bya'o zhes bya ba ni de la zhes bya ni sbrid pa byung ba de la ni gsar bus phyag bya'o //
translated: “To an elder” means that when one is yawning, a young man should prostrate to an elder.

original: sbrid pa byung na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni gsar bu rang la sbrid pa byung na yang rgan po la phyag bya'o //
analyzed: sbrid pa byung na yang ngo zhes bya ba ni gsar bu rang la sbrid pa byung na yang rgan po la phyag bya'o //
translated: If one sneezes, one should say, “May you live long!”

original: 'dir gzhung ni gsar bus sbrid pa byung na phyag bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa la tshe dang ldan pa dang ming dang rus brjod pas kun du spyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gsar bus sbrid pa byung na phyag bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no // de bzhin gshegs pa la tshe dang ldan pa dang ming dang rus brjod pas kun du spyad par mi bya'o //
translated: The text says that if a novice sneezes, he should pay respect to the elder.🔽One should not address the Tathāgata as “venerable” or by name and clan.

original: nye ba'i tshig dang bral bar de'i mtshan nas gdung smos par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'on kyang nye ba'i tshig dang bcas par mtshan nas gdung smos par bya'o //
analyzed: nye ba'i tshig dang bral bar de'i mtshan nas gdung smos par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'on kyang nye ba'i tshig dang bcas par mtshan nas gdung smos par bya'o //
translated: One should not address him by his name and clan without a respectful form of address.

original: 'dir gzhung ni 'di ltar nye ba'i tshig dang bcas te ston pa'i mtshan smos par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni 'di ltar nye ba'i tshig dang bcas te ston pa'i mtshan smos par bya ste /
translated: The text says, “One should address the Teacher by name and clan with a respectful form of address.”

original: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: One should say, “Bhagavān Śākyamuni,” and so on.

original: rgan pa'i mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni nye ba'i tshig dang bral bar ming dang rus smos par mi bya'o //
analyzed: rgan pa'i mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni nye ba'i tshig dang bral bar ming dang rus smos par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not address an elder by name alone, without an honorific term.

original: 'di la gnas brtan dang tshe dang ldan pa ni nye ba'i tshig nyid kyi tshul dang mthun pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di la gnas brtan dang tshe dang ldan pa ni nye ba'i tshig nyid kyi tshul dang mthun pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here, “elder” and “venerable” are suitable honorific terms.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni rgan pa la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni rgan pa la'o //
translated: “Here” means in the case of an elder.

original: snga ma la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa la ste /
analyzed: snga ma la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa la ste /
translated: “Not in the case of the former” means not in the case of the Tathāgata.

original: ston pa la ni gnas brtan dang tshe dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni nye ba'i tshig nyid kyi tshul dang mthun pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ston pa la ni gnas brtan dang tshe dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni nye ba'i tshig nyid kyi tshul dang mthun pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Venerable” and “elder” are not suitable honorific terms for the Teacher.

original: lag gi blas 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dang ldan pa'i gzhir gtsug lag khang rab tu gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang 'gror yang nus la 'ong yang nus @253b pa'i gzhir ro //
analyzed: lag gi blas 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dang ldan pa'i gzhir gtsug lag khang rab tu gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang 'gror yang nus la 'ong yang nus @253b pa'i gzhir ro //
translated: The monastery should be established in a place that is accessible.

original: 'dir gzhung ni ma mo las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni ma mo las /
translated: Here is the text from the Mūlasarvâstivāda Vinaya:

original: phyogs gang du dang po gtsug lag khang rab tu gnas par byed pa de dge slong lag gi blas dang po kho nar gtsug lag khang gi gzhi brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: phyogs gang du dang po gtsug lag khang rab tu gnas par byed pa de dge slong lag gi blas dang po kho nar gtsug lag khang gi gzhi brtag par bya ste /
translated: The novice monk who is the first to consecrate the monastery should first examine the site of the monastery.

original: 'ong ba dang ldan pa dang 'gro ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no ;
analyzed: 'ong ba dang ldan pa dang 'gro ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no ;
translated: He should examine whether the site has a good approach, a good departure, and so on.

original: / shing ljon pa dang rdzing bu dang 'chag sa dag dang ngo zhes bya ba yang ldan pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: / shing ljon pa dang rdzing bu dang 'chag sa dag dang ngo zhes bya ba yang ldan pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: He should also examine whether the site has trees, ponds, and walking paths.

analyzed: shing ljon pa dang ldan pa dang rdzing bu dang ldan pa dang 'chag sa dang ldan pa'i gzhir gtsug lag khang rab tu gnas par bya'o //🔽nyen kor dang ngo zhes bya ba ni nyen kor dang ldan pa'i gtsug lag khang rab tu gnas par bya'o //
translated: The monastery should be consecrated on a site that has trees, ponds, and walking paths.🔽He should also examine whether the site has a good neighborhood. The monastery should be consecrated in a neighborhood that has a good reputation.

original: rgyun lugs dang klag cor dang sgra dang tug ring chung bar ro zhes bya ba ni rgyun lugs nyung ba dang klag cor chung ba dang sgra chung ba dang tug ring chung bar gtsug lag khang rab tu gnas par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyun lugs dang klag cor dang sgra dang tug ring chung bar ro zhes bya ba ni rgyun lugs nyung ba dang klag cor chung ba dang sgra chung ba dang tug ring chung bar gtsug lag khang rab tu gnas par bya'o //
translated: The text says, In a low voice, not loudly, with a low sound, and not with a long or low sound, meaning that the consecration of the monastery should be done in a low voice, not loudly, with a low sound, and not with a long or low sound.

original: bram ze'i klog pa dang 'dun sa'i tha snyad dang glang po che dang rta la sogs pa'i sgra ni sgra'o //
analyzed: bram ze'i klog pa dang 'dun sa'i tha snyad dang glang po che dang rta la sogs pa'i sgra ni sgra'o //
translated: The word sound refers to the sounds of Brahmins reciting, the sounds of assemblies, the sounds of elephants, horses, and so on.

original: rdza rnga la sogs pa'i sgra ni tug ring ste de dag chung bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdza rnga la sogs pa'i sgra ni tug ring ste de dag chung bar bya'o //
translated: The word long refers to the sounds of clay drums and so on, and those should be done in a low way.

analyzed: sbyin pa pos rjes su gnang na gtsug lag khang bya ba'i dngos po las de bya ba'i spyad bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbyin bdag gis rjes su gnang na gtsug lag khang bya ba'i rdzas gang yin pa de la lag gi blas bya ba'i spyad bya ba la
translated: If the donor permits, the monastery should be used for the purpose of work. The text says, If the donor permits, the monastery should be used for the purpose of work, meaning that if the donor allows it, the monastery should be used for the purpose of work.

original: mi rigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mi rigs pa med pa'o //
translated: There is no impropriety in this.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gal te khyim bdag gis rjes su ster na de nyid las spyad nye bar gzhag par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gal te khyim bdag gis rjes su ster na de nyid las spyad nye bar gzhag par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The text here states: “If the householder gives it, it should be placed in the storehouse.”

original: de gzhag pa'i khang pa sbyin no zhes bya ba ni lag gi blas bya ba'i spyad de gzhag pa'i khang pa sbyin par bya ba de dmigs kyis bsal pa'o //
analyzed: de gzhag pa'i khang pa sbyin no zhes bya ba ni lag gi blas bya ba'i spyad de gzhag pa'i khang pa sbyin par bya ba de dmigs kyis bsal pa'o //
translated: “The storehouse” is the place where the work of the hand is stored.

original: de zhes bya ba ni spyad de'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni spyad de'o //
translated: “That” refers to the work of the hand.🔽“The oil and so on that are necessary there should be bought in moderation.” The word “there” includes the work of the hand.🔽“The work of the hand should be eaten in moderation.” The word “there” includes the work of the hand.
