original: gnas de'i gtsug lag khang med pa nyid yin na nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang gi'o zhes bya ba ni ji @254a * //
analyzed: gnas de'i gtsug lag khang med pa nyid yin na nye 'khor gyi gtsug lag khang gi'o zhes bya ba ni ji @254a * //
translated: If there is no temple in that place, then it is the temple of the surrounding area.

original: tsam pa de tsam zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: tsam pa de tsam zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “to the extent” is to be applied here.

original: snum bag gi rnyed pa mnod do zhes bya ba ni 'dir bya na yang dge slong gi thang bzhin du mnod pa'o zhes bya bar rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: snum bag gi rnyed pa mnod do zhes bya ba ni 'dir bya na yang dge slong gi thang bzhin du mnod pa'o zhes bya bar rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: “One should accept the acquisition of oil-based substances” means that even if one accepts them here, it is like the allowance for monks.

original: 'dir de 'dra bar zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir de 'dra bar zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase “in this way” should be applied here.

original: gtsug lag khang dag gi brtsegs ma nyid kyi mtha' ni lnga'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang dag gi brtsegs ma nyid kyi mtha' ni lnga'o //
translated: The maximum height of temples is five stories.

original: dge slong ma rnams kyi ni gsum mo zhes bya ba ni mtha'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma rnams kyi ni gsum mo zhes bya ba ni mtha'o //
translated: The maximum for nuns is three stories.

original: 'dir gzhung ni sil bu dag las dge slong rnams kyi gtsug lag khang ni lnga brtsegs su bya'o //🔽dri gtsang khang ni bdun brtsegs su bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni sil bu dag las dge slong rnams kyi gtsug lag khang ni lnga brtsegs su bya'o // dri gtsang khang ni bdun brtsegs su bya'o //
translated: Here, the scriptures state: “Monks, temples should be built up to five stories.🔽The temple of the Buddha should be built up to seven stories.

original: sgo khang gi steng gi bsil khang yang bdun brtsegs so //
analyzed: sgo khang gi steng gi bsil khang yang bdun brtsegs so //
translated: The upper story of the gate should also be seven stories.”

original: dge slong ma rnams kyi gtsug lag khang ni sum brtsegs su bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma rnams kyi gtsug lag khang ni sum brtsegs su bya'o //
translated: The nunnery is to be three stories high.

original: dri gtsang khang ni lnga brtsegs su so //
analyzed: dri gtsang khang ni lnga brtsegs su so //
translated: The temple is to be five stories high.

original: sgo khang ni steng gi bsil khang yang lnga brtsegs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: sgo khang ni steng gi bsil khang yang lnga brtsegs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The gatehouse is to be five stories high, with a pavilion above.

original: dri gtsang khang dang sgo khang steng gi bsil khang dag ni brtsegs ma gnyis kyis lhag par bya'o //
analyzed: dri gtsang khang dang sgo khang steng gi bsil khang dag ni brtsegs ma gnyis kyis lhag par bya'o //
translated: The temple and the gatehouse are to be built with two stories.

original: de dag lci bas 'jig pa nyid yin na brtsegs ma bshig pa la kha na ma tho ba med do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dag lci bas 'jig pa nyid yin na brtsegs ma bshig pa la kha na ma tho ba med do zhes bya ba la /
translated: If they are destroyed by the weight of the building, there is no offense in demolishing the stories.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni dge slong dang dge slong ma'i gtsug lag khang de dag lci bas 'jig pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni dge slong dang dge slong ma'i gtsug lag khang de dag lci bas 'jig pa nyid yin na /
translated: If they are destroyed by the weight of the building,

original: brtsegs pa bshigs pa la kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: brtsegs pa bshigs pa la kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid yin te /
translated: there is no offense in demolishing the stories.

original: brtsegs ma ji snyed bshig pa gcig gam du ma de snyed bshig par bya'o //
analyzed: brtsegs ma ji snyed bshig pa gcig gam du ma de snyed bshig par bya'o //
translated: One should demolish as many stories as have been built, whether one or many.

original: bdun stobs nyid kyis sel ba zhes bya ba dang kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid ces bya ba shugs kyis rtogs pa ste gtsug lag khang gis zhes bya bar sbyar ro //🔽brtsams pa skyed pa 'am bskyud bar bya ba'i phyir bshig pa yang ngo zhes bya ba yang /
analyzed: bdun stobs nyid kyis sel ba zhes bya ba dang kha na ma tho ba med pa nyid ces bya ba shugs kyis rtogs pa ste gtsug lag khang gis zhes bya bar sbyar ro // brtsams pa skyed pa 'am bskyud bar bya ba'i phyir bshig pa yang ngo zhes bya ba yang /
translated: “Also, if one destroys a monastery in order to build or expand another monastery, there is no offense.”

original: kha na ma tho ba med do zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med do zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: “Also, if one destroys a monastery in order to build or expand another monastery, there is no offense.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni gal te byed du 'jug mi nus na bshig ste chung dur byed du gzhug ste 'di la 'gyod pa mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽mchod rten dang sku gzugs dag ni skyed pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni brtsams pa bshig pa la kha na ma tho ba med ba ste /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gal te byed du 'jug mi nus na bshig ste chung dur byed du gzhug ste 'di la 'gyod pa mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no // mchod rten dang sku gzugs dag ni skyed pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni brtsams pa bshig pa la kha na ma tho ba med ba ste /
translated: The text says, “If one is unable to make repairs, one may destroy the old monastery and build a smaller one in its place. One should not regret this.”🔽“Monasteries and images are not to be destroyed because they are already built.”

original: de gnyis brtsams pa bskyung ba'i phyir bshig pa ni kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gnyis brtsams pa bskyung ba'i phyir bshig pa ni kha na ma tho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Monasteries and images are not to be destroyed because they are already built.”

original: rnyings pa nyid kyi phyir ni zin kyang mnyam pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba la yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras ni kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i rjes snyegs pa'i phyir smos so //
analyzed: rnyings pa nyid kyi phyir ni zin kyang mnyam pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba la yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgras ni kyang ngo zhes bya ba'i rjes snyegs pa'i phyir smos so //
translated: And because of old age, even if it is completed, it is the same. The word “also” is stated because it follows the word “even.”

original: brtsams pa ma zin pa de dag skyed pa 'ba' @254b zhig gi phyir bshig pa la kha na ma tho ba med par ma zad kyi snga ma dang mnyam par bya ba'i phyir bshig pa la yang kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
analyzed: brtsams pa ma zin pa de dag skyed pa 'ba' @254b zhig gi phyir bshig pa la kha na ma tho ba med par ma zad kyi snga ma dang mnyam par bya ba'i phyir bshig pa la yang kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
translated: Not only is there no offense in destroying that which has not been completed, but there is also no offense in destroying that which is the same as the previous.

original: rnyings pa la gang la phyir bcos pas bskyed par bya mi nus pa de la bsnyams pa la kha na ma tho ba med pa 'di gsungs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnyings pa la gang la phyir bcos pas bskyed par bya mi nus pa de la bsnyams pa la kha na ma tho ba med pa 'di gsungs par rig par bya'o //
translated: This is stated to be the absence of an offense in destroying that which is old, for which it is impossible to repair and make new.

original: phyogs gcig phyir bcos pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba ni mchod rten dang sku gzugs kyi phyogs gcig rnyings pa phyir 'chos par bya ba'i phyir bshig pa la yang kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs gcig phyir bcos pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba ni mchod rten dang sku gzugs kyi phyogs gcig rnyings pa phyir 'chos par bya ba'i phyir bshig pa la yang kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
translated: And also because of repairing one part. There is also no offense in destroying that which is the same as the previous, for the purpose of repairing one part of a stupa or image.

original: 'dir gzhung ni mchod rten dang sku gzugs dag rnyings pa na /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni mchod rten dang sku gzugs dag rnyings pa na /
translated: When stupas and images are old,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa phyir bcos par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa phyir bcos par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: the Blessed One has declared that they should be restored.🔽The text of the second sutra is this:

original: mdo snga ma'i gzhung ni skyang nul gyi sku gzugs dag rnyings par gyur pa na /
analyzed: mdo snga ma'i gzhung ni skyang nul gyi sku gzugs dag rnyings par gyur pa na /
translated: When images made of plaster are old,

original: dge slong dag 'gyod pas phyir 'chos par mi byed pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'gyod pas phyir 'chos par mi byed pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: the monks, out of regret, do not restore them. The Blessed One declared:

original: lhag ma 'am mnyam par bya'i chung ba ni mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma 'am mnyam par bya'i chung ba ni mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “You should add to the remainder or make it equal, but not make it smaller.”

original: 'dir mchod rten dang sku gzugs dag 'dra ba nyid de gang zhig 'di dag gi de dag las de lta bu'i rigs can gyi tshig de las gzhan du brjod pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir mchod rten dang sku gzugs dag 'dra ba nyid de gang zhig 'di dag gi de dag las de lta bu'i rigs can gyi tshig de las gzhan du brjod pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, the stupa and the image are similar, and the words of this type are not expressed differently from those.

original: de lta bas na 'di gnyis ka lung gnyis las shes pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di gnyis ka lung gnyis las shes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, both are known from two scriptures.

original: gdugs la sogs bcos pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni rnyings pa phyir gcos pa'i phyir mchod rten dang sku gzugs dag las dbog pa la kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gdugs la sogs bcos pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni rnyings pa phyir gcos pa'i phyir mchod rten dang sku gzugs dag las dbog pa la kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
translated: Also, repairing parasols, etc. means that there is no offense in taking from stupas and images in order to repair old ones.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni char khab la sogs pa dag kyang bsdu'o //🔽gzhan gdags pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba ni rnyings pa phyir bcos par bya ba'i phyir 'bogs pa la kha na ma tho ba med pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi sar pa gzhan gdags pa'i phyir 'bogs pa la yang kha na ma tho ba med pa'o
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni char khab la sogs pa dag kyang bsdu'o // gzhan gdags pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba ni rnyings pa phyir bcos par bya ba'i phyir 'bogs pa la kha na ma tho ba med pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi sar pa gzhan gdags pa'i phyir 'bogs pa la yang kha na ma tho ba med pa'o
translated: The word “etc.” includes repairing the roof, etc.🔽Also, for the sake of designating another means that there is no offense in taking for the sake of designating another new one, not only for the sake of repairing an old one.

original: // de'i don du nye bar ma bzhag par 'gog par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan gdags pa de'i don du gdugs la sogs pa nye bar ma bzhag par snga ma dbog par mi bya'o //
analyzed: // de'i don du nye bar ma bzhag par 'gog par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gzhan gdags pa de'i don du gdugs la sogs pa nye bar ma bzhag par snga ma dbog par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not stop without setting it aside for that purpose means that one should not take the old one without setting aside the parasol, etc. for the sake of designating another new one.

original: 'dir gzhung ni gzhan dag gis gdugs dag phog par gyur nas de dag rab tu dus byed par gyur pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni gzhan dag gis gdugs dag phog par gyur nas de dag rab tu dus byed par gyur pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: ji srid du gzhan dag nye bar ma bzhag pa de srid du dbog par mi bya'o zhes @255a * //
analyzed: ji srid du gzhan dag nye bar ma bzhag pa de srid du dbog par mi bya'o zhes @255a * //
translated: ‘As long as others are not placed nearby, it should not be given.’

original: gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is said.

original: skyes pa'i rabs la sogs pa'i ri mo dang / sangs rgyas kyi bka'i yi ge dag kyang zhes bya ba ni de dag kyang rnyings pa bcos pa'i phyir phyis pa la kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
analyzed: skyes pa'i rabs la sogs pa'i ri mo dang / sangs rgyas kyi bka'i yi ge dag kyang zhes bya ba ni de dag kyang rnyings pa bcos pa'i phyir phyis pa la kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
translated: And also the paintings of the Jātakas, etc., and the letters of the Buddha’s word, when they are old, it is not a downfall to repair them.

original: ci zhig gi phyir phyis pa la bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig gi phyir phyis pa la bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it done?

original: de'i phyir byid pa'i bye brag kho na bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir byid pa'i bye brag kho na bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, ‘only for the purpose of a specific repair.’

original: byid pa'i bye brag gang yin pa de kho na bri ba'i phyir yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: byid pa'i bye brag gang yin pa de kho na bri ba'i phyir yin gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: It is only for the purpose of a specific repair, not for another purpose.

original: rtsom par byed pas ma byas na gzhan gyis lhag ma bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang gis mchod rten dang gtsug lag khang dag rtsom par byed pa de brtsams nas ma zin par ma byas na gzhan gyis de'i lhag ma bya ba la mi rigs pa med pa'o
analyzed: rtsom par byed pas ma byas na gzhan gyis lhag ma bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang gis mchod rten dang gtsug lag khang dag rtsom par byed pa de brtsams nas ma zin par ma byas na gzhan gyis de'i lhag ma bya ba la mi rigs pa med pa'o
translated: If one begins the work of a stupa or a monastery, and does not complete it, it is not wrong for another to complete it.🔽If one builds half for the Sangha, one should give a cart.

original: // gal te dge 'dun gyi phyir phyed brtsigs na 'khar len sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di la tshul dang mi mthun pa med par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: // gal te dge 'dun gyi phyir phyed brtsigs na 'khar len sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'di la tshul dang mi mthun pa med par shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as not contrary to the rules.

original: de bas na de'i brjod pa 'di'o //
analyzed: de bas na de'i brjod pa 'di'o //
translated: Therefore, this is said about it.

original: 'dir phyed ces bya ba'i sgra ni cha shas la snyegs kyi cha mnyam pa'i phyed kho na ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir phyed ces bya ba'i sgra ni cha shas la snyegs kyi cha mnyam pa'i phyed kho na ni ma yin te /
translated: Here, the word half refers to a part, not just to a half of an equal part.

original: cung zad tsam brtsigs nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: cung zad tsam brtsigs nas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means having built just a little.

original: 'dir rnam par 'byed pa las /
analyzed: 'dir rnam par 'byed pa las /
translated: Here, in the Vinaya, it is said:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:🔽Monks, if one builds a monastery for the Sangha, one should give a cart.

original: gzhi ma zin pa la zhes bya ba nas 'di ltar lhan cig bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhi ma zin pa la zhes bya ba nas 'di ltar lhan cig bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The phrase those who have not yet taken hold of the foundation refers to those who have not yet attained the first meditative absorption.🔽 The phrase should practice together refers to those who have attained the first meditative absorption.

original: des bstang ba'i dus ni gal te dgun yin na zas kyi 'og rol du'o //
analyzed: des bstang ba'i dus ni gal te dgun yin na zas kyi 'og rol du'o //
translated: The time for the rite is after the meal if it is winter,

original: gal te so ga yin na zas kyi mdun rol du'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te so ga yin na zas kyi mdun rol du'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: and before the meal if it is summer.

original: dus ni mkhar len gyis bstang ba de'i dus so //
analyzed: dus ni mkhar len gyis bstang ba de'i dus so //
translated: The time is the time for the rite, as stated by the Buddha.🔽The text says,

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag so ga ni zas kyi 'og rol du las byed la /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag so ga ni zas kyi 'og rol du las byed la /
translated: “Monks, in summer the rite is performed after the meal,

original: dgun ni zas kyi mdun rol du las byed nas /
analyzed: dgun ni zas kyi mdun rol du las byed nas /
translated: and in winter the rite is performed before the meal.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dgun ni zas kyi 'og rol du las bya la /🔽so gas ni zas kyis mdun rol du las bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dgun ni zas kyi 'og rol du las bya la / so gas ni zas kyis mdun rol du las bya'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “In winter the rite is performed after the meal,🔽and in summer the rite is performed before the meal.”🔽The time for the rite is when the time for eating has passed.

original: zas kyi bya ba'i dus lus par ro zhes bya ba ni ji srid du zas kyi bya ba lhung bzed bkru ba la sogs pa dag gi dus las yol bar gyur pa de srid du las mi bya'o //
analyzed: zas kyi bya ba'i dus lus par ro zhes bya ba ni ji srid du zas kyi bya ba lhung bzed bkru ba la sogs pa dag gi dus las yol bar gyur pa de srid du las mi bya'o //
translated: The rite should not be performed until the time for eating has passed, until the time for washing the begging bowl and so on, which is the time for the activity of eating, has passed.

original: de'i las byi dor ma byas par 'tsho ba la 'jug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i las byi dor ma byas par 'tsho ba la 'jug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: One should not engage in livelihood without having performed the duties of cleaning.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni bstang ba'i bya ba las so //
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni bstang ba'i bya ba las so //
translated: Here, “from that” means from the activity of cleaning.

original: 'tsho ba las zhes bya ba ni bsod snyoms kyi phyir 'gro ba la sogs @255b pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba las zhes bya ba ni bsod snyoms kyi phyir 'gro ba la sogs @255b pa'o //
translated: “From livelihood” means from going out for alms, and so on.

original: de'i mtha' ni rkang lag bkrus pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i mtha' ni rkang lag bkrus pa nyid do zhes bya ba la /
translated: The conclusion of that is just washing the feet.

original: de'i mtha' zhes bya ba ni byi dor byas pa de'i mtha'o //
analyzed: de'i mtha' zhes bya ba ni byi dor byas pa de'i mtha'o //
translated: Here, “the conclusion of that” means the conclusion of that cleaning.

original: 'dir mtha'i sgra ni 'di thams cad las chung ba nyid la smos so //
analyzed: 'dir mtha'i sgra ni 'di thams cad las chung ba nyid la smos so //
translated: The word “conclusion” here refers to the smallest part of all this.

original: lag gi blas khye'u sus sbyor du gzhug go zhes bya ba ni gal te dge slong dag zas kyi mdun rol du byed na de'i tshe lag gi blas khye'u sas sbyor du gzhug go //
analyzed: lag gi blas khye'u sus sbyor du gzhug go zhes bya ba ni gal te dge slong dag zas kyi mdun rol du byed na de'i tshe lag gi blas khye'u sas sbyor du gzhug go //
translated: “By whom should the boy be engaged?” means if the monks do it before the meal, then the boy should be engaged by the attendant.

original: zas kyi 'og rol du ni skom dang rkang lag bsku mnye bya'o zhes bya ba ni gal te dge slong dag zas kyi 'og rol du las byed na de'i tshe lag gi blas skom la sogs pa sbyor du gzhug pa'o //🔽gnas khang dag gi sgo gdod do //
analyzed: zas kyi 'og rol du ni skom dang rkang lag bsku mnye bya'o zhes bya ba ni gal te dge slong dag zas kyi 'og rol du las byed na de'i tshe lag gi blas skom la sogs pa sbyor du gzhug pa'o // gnas khang dag gi sgo gdod do //
translated: If the monks do work after eating, then the attendant should prepare water, etc.

original: sgo glegs gzhug go //
analyzed: sgo glegs gzhug go //
translated: One should close the doors of the living quarters.🔽One should close the door panels.

original: lag gzungs dang yang mig dang ko ba'i dum bu dag go zhes bya ba ni gzhug go zhes bya ba'i rjes su sbyar ro //
analyzed: lag gzungs dang yang mig dang ko ba'i dum bu dag go zhes bya ba ni gzhug go zhes bya ba'i rjes su sbyar ro //
translated: One should prepare the door bolts, door hinges, and leather door flaps.

original: skar khung dag gdod do zhes bya ba ni gnas khang la'o //
analyzed: skar khung dag gdod do zhes bya ba ni gnas khang la'o //
translated: One should open the windows.

original: phyogs gang du gdod par bya zhe na de'i phyir dkyil du'o zhes bya ba smos te rtsig ngos kyi'o //
analyzed: phyogs gang du gdod par bya zhe na de'i phyir dkyil du'o zhes bya ba smos te rtsig ngos kyi'o //
translated: In which direction should one open them? Therefore it says, “In the middle.”

original: dbyibs ci 'dra ba zhe na /
analyzed: dbyibs ci 'dra ba zhe na /
translated: What shape should they be?

original: phyi rub la nang yangs pa rgya mtsho'i rnam pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: phyi rub la nang yangs pa rgya mtsho'i rnam pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It says, “Outside they are narrow, inside they are wide, and they are shaped like the ocean.”

original: rgya mtsho ltar byin gyis yangs pa'o //
analyzed: rgya mtsho ltar byin gyis yangs pa'o //
translated: They are blessed to be wide like the ocean.

original: dra ba gzhug go zhes bya ba ni stegs bu'i rnam pa 'dir rig par bya ste skar khung la ste /
analyzed: dra ba gzhug go zhes bya ba ni stegs bu'i rnam pa 'dir rig par bya ste skar khung la ste /
translated: The word “lattice” means a kind of platform.

original: dra ba zhes bya ba gang zhig bstan pa de ni 'dir stegs bu de'o //
analyzed: dra ba zhes bya ba gang zhig bstan pa de ni 'dir stegs bu de'o //
translated: The lattice is the platform.

original: sgo glegs so zhes bya ba ni skar khung la gzhug par bya'o //🔽'khor gtan dang gnam gzer dang 'phred gtan dag go zhes bya ba ni sgo glegs de la gzhug par bya /
analyzed: sgo glegs so zhes bya ba ni skar khung la gzhug par bya'o // 'khor gtan dang gnam gzer dang 'phred gtan dag go zhes bya ba ni sgo glegs de la gzhug par bya /
translated: The “door-panel” is to be inserted in the lattice.

original: dbyug gu skam kha bcang ngo //
analyzed: dbyug gu skam kha bcang ngo //
translated: The “pivot-socket” and the “cross-bar” are to be inserted in the door-panel.🔽The “door-bolt” is to be fixed.

original: gsor gyis btsugs pas rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni thag ma rgyu ba thams cad ni gsor gyis btsugs pa'i thabs kyis bya ba'o //🔽gnas khang gi mdun du khyams bya'o zhes bya ba smos na /
analyzed: gsor gyis btsugs pas rgyu'o zhes bya ba ni thag ma rgyu ba thams cad ni gsor gyis btsugs pa'i thabs kyis bya ba'o // gnas khang gi mdun du khyams bya'o zhes bya ba smos na /
translated: All the ropes are to be fixed with pegs.🔽“In front of the dwelling, a courtyard is to be made.”

original: phyogs gang du bya zhe na de'i phyir gnas khang gi mdun du'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: phyogs gang du bya zhe na de'i phyir gnas khang gi mdun du'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In which direction? In front of the dwelling.

original: rim pa gang gis 'di bya zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: rim pa gang gis 'di bya zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: In what order is this to be done?

original: so phag gi gcal bdun nam brgyad gzhug go zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: so phag gi gcal bdun nam brgyad gzhug go zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The floor should be made of seven or eight layers of bricks.

original: gnas khang gi rtsig pa'i 'og gzhi'i gcal du so phag rim pa bdun nam brgyad gzhug par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnas khang gi rtsig pa'i 'og gzhi'i gcal du so phag rim pa bdun nam brgyad gzhug par bya ba'o //
translated: The floor of the lower part of the house should be made of seven or eight layers of bricks.🔽On top of that, a wooden floor.

original: de'i steng du ka tan gyi spang leb bo zhes bya ba smos pas ka tan gyi spang leb gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni so phag gi gcal de'i ste 'du ka tan gyi spang leb @256a * //🔽gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du ka tan gyi spang leb bo zhes bya ba smos pas ka tan gyi spang leb gzhug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni so phag gi gcal de'i ste 'du ka tan gyi spang leb @256a * // gzhug par bya'o //
translated: The wooden floor should be placed on top of the brick floor.🔽On top of that, a row of pillars.

original: de'i steng du ka ba'i tshar dag go zhes bya ba ni ka tan gyi spang leb de'i steng du ka ba'i tshar dag gzugs pa'o //🔽de dag gi steng du ka zhu'i 'dab ma dag go zhes bya ba la /🔽de dag gi zhes bya ba ni ka ba'i tshar de dag gi steng du ka zhu'i 'dab ma dag gzhug pa'o //🔽de dag gi steng du gdung ma dag go //
analyzed: de'i steng du ka ba'i tshar dag go zhes bya ba ni ka tan gyi spang leb de'i steng du ka ba'i tshar dag gzugs pa'o // de dag gi steng du ka zhu'i 'dab ma dag go zhes bya ba la / de dag gi zhes bya ba ni ka ba'i tshar de dag gi steng du ka zhu'i 'dab ma dag gzhug pa'o // de dag gi steng du gdung ma dag go //
translated: A row of pillars should be erected on top of the wooden floor.🔽On top of that, rafters.

original: de dag gi steng du phyam dag go //
analyzed: de dag gi steng du phyam dag go //
translated: On top of that, a roof.🔽On top of that, a layer of mud.🔽On top of that, a layer of cow dung.🔽On top of that, a layer of lime.

original: de dag ge steng du spang leb dag go //🔽de dag gi steng du so phag dgram mo //
analyzed: de dag ge steng du spang leb dag go // de dag gi steng du so phag dgram mo //
translated: On top of those, bricks.🔽On top of those, tiles.

original: de dag gi steng du so phag gi phye ma'i 'jim pa'o zhes bya ba ni de dag gi steng du so phag gi phye ma'i 'jim pa glan par bya ba'o //🔽mi ltung bar bya ba'i phyir lan kan bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi steng du so phag gi phye ma'i 'jim pa'o zhes bya ba ni de dag gi steng du so phag gi phye ma'i 'jim pa glan par bya ba'o // mi ltung bar bya ba'i phyir lan kan bya'o //
translated: On top of those, plaster of brick-powder. On top of those, plaster of brick-powder should be applied.🔽A fence should be made to prevent falling.

original: mi 'gul bar bya ba'i phyir shar ba gzhug go //🔽de lcags kyi gzer bu dag gis sbyar ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi 'gul bar bya ba'i phyir shar ba gzhug go // de lcags kyi gzer bu dag gis sbyar ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: A beam should be inserted to prevent shaking.🔽It is fastened with iron nails.

original: de zhes bya ba de shar ba de'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba de shar ba de'o //
translated: It, that beam, is fastened with iron nails.

original: 'dzeg pa'i phyir them skas bya'o //
analyzed: 'dzeg pa'i phyir them skas bya'o //
translated: A ladder should be made for climbing.

original: 'og tu rdo las byas pa bar du sa las byas pa /
analyzed: 'og tu rdo las byas pa bar du sa las byas pa /
translated: Below, it is made of stone; in the middle, of earth;

original: steng du shing las byas pa'o //
analyzed: steng du shing las byas pa'o //
translated: above, of wood.

original: ya gad las 'dzeg par bya'o //
analyzed: ya gad las 'dzeg par bya'o //
translated: One should climb by the side.

original: shing dang smyig ma dang thag pa las byas pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni shing las byas pa dang smyig ma las byas pa dang thag pa las byas pa rnams so //
analyzed: shing dang smyig ma dang thag pa las byas pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni shing las byas pa dang smyig ma las byas pa dang thag pa las byas pa rnams so //
translated: Made of wood, bamboo, or rope. Made of wood, made of bamboo, made of rope.

original: rdzing bu dang sgo khang du rdzab mi 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir so phag gi gcal gzhug go //🔽de'i steng so phag gi phye ma'i 'jim pa'o zhes bya ba ni so phag gi gcal de'i steng du'o //
analyzed: rdzing bu dang sgo khang du rdzab mi 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir so phag gi gcal gzhug go // de'i steng so phag gi phye ma'i 'jim pa'o zhes bya ba ni so phag gi gcal de'i steng du'o //
translated: In order to prevent mud in the ponds and in the doorways, a brick pavement is laid.🔽On top of that, clay mixed with brick-dust. On top of that brick pavement.

original: de'i steng du rdo thal gyis so zhes bya ba ni so phag gi steng ma'i 'jim pa de'i steng du rdo thal gyi skyang nul gyis bsku bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du rdo thal gyis so zhes bya ba ni so phag gi steng ma'i 'jim pa de'i steng du rdo thal gyi skyang nul gyis bsku bar bya ba'o //
translated: On top of that, plaster of lime. On top of that clay mixed with brick-dust, plaster of lime is to be applied.

original: med na rkang pa bskyab pa'i phyir shing gi spang leb so zhes bya ba ni gcal ji ltar bstan pa'i rdzas de dag med na rkang pa bskyab pa'i phyir spang leb gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: med na rkang pa bskyab pa'i phyir shing gi spang leb so zhes bya ba ni gcal ji ltar bstan pa'i rdzas de dag med na rkang pa bskyab pa'i phyir spang leb gzhug par bya'o //
translated: If that is not available, then in order to protect the feet, wooden planks. If the materials for the pavement as described are not available, then in order to protect the feet, wooden planks are to be laid.

original: yang na bar bar du so phag go zhes bya ba ni rkang pa bskyab pa'i phyir gzhug ba'o //
analyzed: yang na bar bar du so phag go zhes bya ba ni rkang pa bskyab pa'i phyir gzhug ba'o //
translated: Or, bricks in between. Or, bricks are to be laid in order to protect the feet.

original: mchod rten la yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rdzab mi 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir so phag gi gcal gzhug go zhes bya ba nas so phag dag go zhes bya ba'i bar de dag de bzhin du gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: mchod rten la yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rdzab mi 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir so phag gi gcal gzhug go zhes bya ba nas so phag dag go zhes bya ba'i bar de dag de bzhin du gzhug pa'o //
translated: In order to prevent the accumulation of water, a brick floor is laid, up to the bricks.

original: 'di la de 'dom gang tsam byas pa nyid na byas pa nyid do zhes bya ba la de zhes bya ba ni gcal de'o //
analyzed: 'di la de 'dom gang tsam byas pa nyid na byas pa nyid do zhes bya ba la de zhes bya ba ni gcal de'o //
translated: Here, it is just one cubit in size, and it is made.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni mchod rten la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni mchod rten la'o //
translated: Here refers to the stupa.

original: seng ge'i khri gru bzhi bya'o //
analyzed: seng ge'i khri gru bzhi bya'o //
translated: The lion throne should be square.

original: rkang pa dag la seng ge'i gdong @256b nyid do //
analyzed: rkang pa dag la seng ge'i gdong @256b nyid do //
translated: The legs have the faces of lions.

original: spo ba'i phyir gzung ba'i don du bzhi po de dag la lcags kyi yang mig dag gdags so zhes bya ba la de dag la zhes bya ba ni rkang pa bzhi po dag la'o //
analyzed: spo ba'i phyir gzung ba'i don du bzhi po de dag la lcags kyi yang mig dag gdags so zhes bya ba la de dag la zhes bya ba ni rkang pa bzhi po dag la'o //
translated: In order to move them and to hold them, iron rings are attached to those four legs.

original: thag gu dag gis gdags so //
analyzed: thag gu dag gis gdags so //
translated: The ropes are attached to them.

original: der stan nang tshangs can gzhag go //
analyzed: der stan nang tshangs can gzhag go //
translated: A soft cushion is placed on them.

original: steng du bla re 'o zhes bya ba ni gdags pa'o //
analyzed: steng du bla re 'o zhes bya ba ni gdags pa'o //
translated: An awning is placed above.

original: dpyang ba dag go zhes bya ba ni yang gdags pa'o //
analyzed: dpyang ba dag go zhes bya ba ni yang gdags pa'o //
translated: “Hanging” is another designation.

original: brtan pa la ni so phag las byas pa'i them skas bya'o zhes bya ba ni mi bskyod pa'i chos can brtan pa la'o //
analyzed: brtan pa la ni so phag las byas pa'i them skas bya'o zhes bya ba ni mi bskyod pa'i chos can brtan pa la'o //
translated: “For the stable, a ladder made of bricks” means for the stable one who has the quality of being unshakable.

original: spo ba las ni shing las byas pa'o //
analyzed: spo ba las ni shing las byas pa'o //
translated: “For the mobile, one made of wood.”

original: ma 'byor na ya gad do zhes bya ba ni them skas ma 'byor na 'di bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma 'byor na ya gad do zhes bya ba ni them skas ma 'byor na 'di bya ba'o //
translated: “If that is not available, a rope” means if a ladder is not available, this should be used.

original: rkang rten yang ngo zhes bya ba ni gang du rkang pa gnyis mi 'phyang ba ni 'dir dgos pa zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rkang rten yang ngo zhes bya ba ni gang du rkang pa gnyis mi 'phyang ba ni 'dir dgos pa zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: “And a foot-rest” means where the two feet do not hang down, that is taught as the purpose here.

original: de bas na gang du rkang pa 'phyang ba de rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na gang du rkang pa 'phyang ba de rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, where the feet hang down, that should be understood.

original: mchod pa'o zhes bya ba ni rkang rten la'o zhes bya ba de ma thag par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mchod pa'o zhes bya ba ni rkang rten la'o zhes bya ba de ma thag par shes par bya'o //
translated: “Worship” should be understood immediately after “on the foot-rest.”

original: steng du lo ma'i chun po 'am rtsva'i chun po gzhug go //
analyzed: steng du lo ma'i chun po 'am rtsva'i chun po gzhug go //
translated: “Above, a bundle of leaves or a bundle of grass should be placed.”

original: 'di ni rkang pa gnyis mi 'phyang bar bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di ni rkang pa gnyis mi 'phyang bar bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is for the purpose of not letting the two feet hang down.🔽“For the stable, a ladder made of bricks” means for the stable one who has the quality of being unshakable.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rkang pa'i rten la'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rkang pa'i rten la'o //
translated: This refers to the support of the feet.

original: 'di ni rdos 'grub po zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di ni rdos 'grub po zhes bya ba la /
translated: This is made of wood means:

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rkang pa gnyis mi 'phyang ba 'di'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rkang pa gnyis mi 'phyang ba 'di'o //
translated: This refers to the two feet not hanging down.

original: zan za ba dag la khra dang bye'u dag phug ron dag gis mi 'tshe bar bya ba'i phyir bya rgya bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang du khva ta la sogs pa 'byung ba der zhes bya ba ni don gyis shes pa'o //
analyzed: zan za ba dag la khra dang bye'u dag phug ron dag gis mi 'tshe bar bya ba'i phyir bya rgya bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang du khva ta la sogs pa 'byung ba der zhes bya ba ni don gyis shes pa'o //
translated: In order to prevent crows, birds, and pigeons from harming those who eat food, a bird-scarer should be made means that where crows, etc. occur, it should be made.

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag khyams su zan za ba na /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag khyams su zan za ba na /
translated: The text here is: Monks, when eating food in the courtyard,

original: de dag khva dang bye'u dang phug ron dag gis 'tshe nas /
analyzed: de dag khva dang bye'u dang phug ron dag gis 'tshe nas /
translated: they were harmed by crows, birds, and pigeons.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: bya rgya bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: bya rgya bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: A bird-scarer should be made.

original: rnam pa bzhi'o zhes bya ba ni bya rgya de'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi'o zhes bya ba ni bya rgya de'o //
translated: The four types refers to that bird-scarer.

original: munydza las byas pa dang / bal ba rdza las byas pa dang / sha na las byas pa dang / ras bal las byas pa'o zhes bya ba ni gleng gzhi dag las de gsungs pa dang / 'dir gzhung ni phran tshegs dag las kyang dra ba ni rnam pa lnga ste /🔽lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: munydza las byas pa dang / bal ba rdza las byas pa dang / sha na las byas pa dang / ras bal las byas pa'o zhes bya ba ni gleng gzhi dag las de gsungs pa dang / 'dir gzhung ni phran tshegs dag las kyang dra ba ni rnam pa lnga ste / lnga gang zhe na /
translated: Those made of silk, cotton, wool, linen, and coarse wool.🔽The Ksudraka Collection mentions five types of robes:

original: sha na las byas pa dang / munydza las byas pa dang / bal ba rdza las byas pa dang / ka sha las byas pa dang / ku sha las byas pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /🔽de dag ni 'gal bar shes par mi bya ste /
analyzed: sha na las byas pa dang / munydza las byas pa dang / bal ba rdza las byas pa dang / ka sha las byas pa dang / ku sha las byas pa'o zhes gsungs pa yin te / de dag ni 'gal bar shes par mi bya ste /
translated: those made of silk, cotton, wool, linen, and coarse wool.

original: de ni gnyis ka la yang dpe nyid du @257a * //
analyzed: de ni gnyis ka la yang dpe nyid du @257a * //
translated: But these two passages are not contradictory.🔽The Kṣudraka Collection passage is not a definition of robes,

original: rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but is a mere example.🔽The passage from the Kṣudraka Collection mentions coarse wool,

original: bal ba dza smos pas ni sngar gyi ka sha las byas pa dang / ku sha las byas pa dag kyang 'phangs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bal ba dza smos pas ni sngar gyi ka sha las byas pa dang / ku sha las byas pa dag kyang 'phangs par shes par bya'o //
translated: but the passage from the Vinaya mentions coarse wool and linen.

original: sha na las byas pa zhes smos pas ni phyi ma ras bal las byas pa yang 'phangs so //
analyzed: sha na las byas pa zhes smos pas ni phyi ma ras bal las byas pa yang 'phangs so //
translated: The phrase made of leather also implies that it is made of cotton.

original: gru bzhi dag tu gzungs gzer gdab po //
analyzed: gru bzhi dag tu gzungs gzer gdab po //
translated: The pegs should be placed in the four corners.

original: de dag la yang gdags so zhes bya ba ni gzungs gzer de dag la bya rgya gdags so //
analyzed: de dag la yang gdags so zhes bya ba ni gzungs gzer de dag la bya rgya gdags so //
translated: They should also be attached means that the pegs should be attached to the net.

original: shing gi ni 'chag pa dang 'drul bas de'i phyir lcags las byas pa dag go zhes bya ba ni gzungs gzer gdags pa'o //
analyzed: shing gi ni 'chag pa dang 'drul bas de'i phyir lcags las byas pa dag go zhes bya ba ni gzungs gzer gdags pa'o //
translated: Since the wood would break and rot, therefore they are made of iron. This refers to the pegs.

original: de'i phyogs gcig tu mthongs gdod do zhes bya ba la de'i 'o zhes bya ba de ni bya rgya de'i 'o //
analyzed: de'i phyogs gcig tu mthongs gdod do zhes bya ba la de'i 'o zhes bya ba de ni bya rgya de'i 'o //
translated: In one part of it, a hole should be made. The phrase in it refers to the net.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: zas zos zin nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes smos te /
analyzed: zas zos zin nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes smos te /
translated: Because it is used after eating.

original: khva ta la sogs pa rnams zhes bya ba shugs kyis shes pa'o //🔽de dro kar dgab bo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: khva ta la sogs pa rnams zhes bya ba shugs kyis shes pa'o // de dro kar dgab bo zhes bya ba la /
translated: Crows and so on is understood by implication.

original: de zhes bya ba ni mthongs de'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni mthongs de'o //
translated: It should be covered during the day. The phrase it refers to the hole.

original: dbyar dag khyams su chu mi 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir spang leb dag go zhes bya ba ni gzhug go zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dbyar dag khyams su chu mi 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir spang leb dag go zhes bya ba ni gzhug go zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The wooden planks are for the purpose of preventing water from entering the courtyard during the rainy season.

original: phyogs gan du zhe na de'i phyir ka ba'i bar dag tu'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: phyogs gan du zhe na de'i phyir ka ba'i bar dag tu'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: If it is asked, “In which direction?” it is said, “Between the pillars.”

original: ci thams cad du'am zhe na de'i phyir snang bar bya ba'i phyogs ma gtogs par ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ci thams cad du'am zhe na de'i phyir snang bar bya ba'i phyogs ma gtogs par ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: If it is asked, “In all directions?” it is said, “Except for the side that is exposed to the light.”

original: med na seg dag gam re sde dag go zhes bya ba ni spang len dag med na seg dag gam re lde dag gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: med na seg dag gam re sde dag go zhes bya ba ni spang len dag med na seg dag gam re lde dag gzhug par bya'o //
translated: If there are no wooden planks, then there are wooden poles or bamboo poles.

original: dbyar gyi zla ba bzhi po dag gi mthar de dbyung ngo zhes bya ba ni spang leb la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbyar gyi zla ba bzhi po dag gi mthar de dbyung ngo zhes bya ba ni spang leb la sogs pa'o //
translated: At the end of the four months of the rainy season, they are removed.

original: 'khor gyi khyams bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'khor gyi khyams bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: The courtyard is to be made.

original: khyams ni kun nas zlum pa ste 'khor gang la yod pa de ni khyams zlum pa'o //

translated: The remaining tasks that are necessary, such as sweeping, should be done by the entire saṅgha at that time, in this order.

original: chos kyi mdun sar chag chag dang lci ba 'jam po'i byug go zhes bya ba ni gso sbyong dang dgag dbye la sogs pa chos kyi 'dun sa'i gnas der ro //🔽mjug tu khrus bya'o zhes bya ba ni phyag dar la sogs pa zin pa'i mjug tu'o //
analyzed: chos kyi mdun sar chag chag dang lci ba 'jam po'i byug go zhes bya ba ni gso sbyong dang dgag dbye la sogs pa chos kyi 'dun sa'i gnas der ro // mjug tu khrus bya'o zhes bya ba ni phyag dar la sogs pa zin pa'i mjug tu'o //
translated: In the Dharma courtyard, one should sprinkle and sweep.🔽In the end, one should bathe.

original: yang na rkang lag bkru'o //
analyzed: yang na rkang lag bkru'o //
translated: At the end of sweeping and so on, or one should wash one's feet.🔽One should also anoint one's body with water.

original: chus brlan pas lus kyang byug go zhes bya ba ni rdzas kyi ngo bo bstan bas lag pa la sogs pa rnams gang yang rung ba des zhes bya ba shes par bya'o //
analyzed: chus brlan pas lus kyang byug go zhes bya ba ni rdzas kyi ngo bo bstan bas lag pa la sogs pa rnams gang yang rung ba des zhes bya ba shes par bya'o //
translated: By teaching the nature of the substance, it should be understood that any of them, such as the hands, are used.

original: snum bag gi nyed pa bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshe brgyad dang bcu bzhi dang bco lnga la'o //
analyzed: snum bag gi nyed pa bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshe brgyad dang bcu bzhi dang bco lnga la'o //
translated: One should perform an oil massage on the eighth, fourteenth, and fifteenth days.

original: dkon mchog gi don du phyag dar byas pa dang zhal zhal byas pa dag /
analyzed: dkon mchog gi don du phyag dar byas pa dang zhal zhal byas pa dag /
translated: The sweeping and plastering done for the sake of the Three Jewels,

original: dri gtsang khang dang sku gzugs dang mchod rten dang srog shing gi grib ma la gtsug lag gi tshigs su bcad pa gdon cing 'gom mo zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dri gtsang khang dang sku gzugs dang mchod rten dang srog shing gi grib ma la gtsug lag gi tshigs su bcad pa gdon cing 'gom mo zhes bya ba la /
translated: and the recitation of the verses of the scriptures while stepping over the shadow of the temple, the image, the stupa, and the life-tree.

original: 'dir zhal zhes bya ba ni byug pa la rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhal zhes bya ba ni byug pa la rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, the word plastering should be understood as anointing.

original: nyi ma de nyid la gnas mal la so sor brtags la des bcos par bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshes brgyad dang bcu bzhi'i nyi ma de dag la'o //
analyzed: nyi ma de nyid la gnas mal la so sor brtags la des bcos par bya'o zhes bya ba ni tshes brgyad dang bcu bzhi'i nyi ma de dag la'o //
translated: On that very day, the beds should be examined and repaired by him.

original: sus de la so sor brtag par bya zhe na /
analyzed: sus de la so sor brtag par bya zhe na /
translated: By whom should they be examined?

original: de'i phyir rdol ba la sogs pa @259b dang ldan pa dag gis so zhes bya ba smos te mal cha la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir rdol ba la sogs pa @259b dang ldan pa dag gis so zhes bya ba smos te mal cha la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore it is said, by those who have holes, etc. referring to bedding, etc.

original: sus bcos par bya zhe na /
analyzed: sus bcos par bya zhe na /
translated: By whom should they be repaired?

original: de'i phyir gnas pa dag gis so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas pa dag gis so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, by the residents.

original: de dag nyid kyis 'dir mkhan po dang slob dpon dag gis mal stan la sogs pa bcos par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid kyis 'dir mkhan po dang slob dpon dag gis mal stan la sogs pa bcos par bya'o //
translated: By them alone, here the preceptors and teachers should repair the bedding, etc.

original: gnas mal gyi gzhir chag chag dang phyag dar dang / lci ba 'jam po'i byug pas bsku bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni ma mo las 'di dang por byas nas bkru'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas mal gyi gzhir chag chag dang phyag dar dang / lci ba 'jam po'i byug pas bsku bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni ma mo las 'di dang por byas nas bkru'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: One should sprinkle the bedding, sweep it, and anoint it with a smooth paste of cow dung. This is stated in the Mother Scripture, which also says that one should first do this and then bathe.

original: mal cha dri mas gos pa sprug par bya'o //🔽gal te ha cang na sprug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gal te ha cang dri ma can du gyur na 'gyur byed kyi chu la sogs pas bkru bar bya'o //
analyzed: mal cha dri mas gos pa sprug par bya'o // gal te ha cang na sprug par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gal te ha cang dri ma can du gyur na 'gyur byed kyi chu la sogs pas bkru bar bya'o //
translated: One should beat the bedding if it is soiled.🔽If it is very soiled, one should wash it with a decoction of soap-nut.

original: chag chag gdab pa'i 'og tu phyag go //🔽de'i 'og tu bsham mo zhes bya ba ni phyag dar byas pa'i 'og tu mal dang stan bsham par bya'o //
analyzed: chag chag gdab pa'i 'og tu phyag go // de'i 'og tu bsham mo zhes bya ba ni phyag dar byas pa'i 'og tu mal dang stan bsham par bya'o //
translated: One should sweep after sprinkling, not before.🔽One should arrange the bedding and seat after sweeping, not before.

original: gzhi rdul dang bcas pa ma sprugs pa la mi bya'o zhes bya ba mal dang stan gyi gzhi khri la sogs pa rdul dang bcas pa nyid yin na de ma sprugs pa'i steng du mal dang stan bsham par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gzhi rdul dang bcas pa ma sprugs pa la mi bya'o zhes bya ba mal dang stan gyi gzhi khri la sogs pa rdul dang bcas pa nyid yin na de ma sprugs pa'i steng du mal dang stan bsham par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not arrange the bedding and seat on a dusty floor that has not been swept.

original: bsham par bya ba dag la gos cig sprug par spyad do zhes bya ba ni mal stan bsham par bya ba de dag gi'o //🔽gos ji lta bu zhig ce na de'i phyir /
analyzed: bsham par bya ba dag la gos cig sprug par spyad do zhes bya ba ni mal stan bsham par bya ba de dag gi'o // gos ji lta bu zhig ce na de'i phyir /
translated: The phrase in order to beat a single robe that is to be spread out refers to the robes that are to be spread out on the beds.

original: ngan pa'o zhes bya ba smos te thams cad kyi tha ma'o //🔽de bcos so zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ngan pa'o zhes bya ba smos te thams cad kyi tha ma'o // de bcos so zhes bya ba la /
translated: What kind of robe? The phrase a poor robe means the worst of all.

original: de zhes bya ba ni phyir bcos pa de'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni phyir bcos pa de'o //
translated: The phrase he should repair it means that he should mend it.

original: sprug pa'i don du spyad pa'i don gos ngan pa de'o //
analyzed: sprug pa'i don du spyad pa'i don gos ngan pa de'o //
translated: The phrase that refers to the poor robe that is to be used for beating.

original: mi nus pa nyid na ras mar byas te shing bu'i rtse mo la btags nas sprug go zhe bya ba ni des khri la sogs pa dag sprug go zhes bya bar sbyar ro //🔽de ltar yang mi rung ba nyid ma yin na /
analyzed: mi nus pa nyid na ras mar byas te shing bu'i rtse mo la btags nas sprug go zhe bya ba ni des khri la sogs pa dag sprug go zhes bya bar sbyar ro // de ltar yang mi rung ba nyid ma yin na /
translated: If he is unable to do so, he should make a ball of clay, attach it to the end of a stick, and beat it. The phrase he should beat it is to be supplied.

original: sbyin pa po'i bsod nams mngon par spel ba dang yun ring ba nyid du bya ba'i phyir lci ba dang sa bsres te ka ba dang rtsig pa'i ser kar glan par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sbyin pa po'i bsod nams mngon par spel ba dang yun ring ba nyid du bya ba'i phyir lci ba dang sa bsres te ka ba dang rtsig pa'i ser kar glan par bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: If that is not possible, then in order to increase the merit of the donor and to make it last a long time, he should mix clay with the dirt from his own body and apply it to the cracks in the walls and pillars.

original: de ltar yang zhes bya ba ni de ltar byas kyang mi rung pa nyid yin na'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang zhes bya ba ni de ltar byas kyang mi rung pa nyid yin na'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Thus means that even if one does it that way, it is not right.

original: sgo khang dang khyams su mal bca' ba dang bcas na yang gzung bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni de dag tu mal bca' bar yang mi bya gzhan gyis bcas na yang rang gis gzung bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgo khang dang khyams su mal bca' ba dang bcas na yang gzung bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni de dag tu mal bca' bar yang mi bya gzhan gyis bcas na yang rang gis gzung bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If one spreads a mat in a gateway or courtyard, one should not take it up means that one should not spread a mat there, and if another has spread it, one should not take it up oneself.

original: 'dir brtags pa ni skyon yin te gzung bas kyang ngo //
analyzed: 'dir brtags pa ni skyon yin te gzung bas kyang ngo //
translated: Here, the fault is in examining it, and also in taking it up.

original: gzhan gyis bcas na yang gnas khang yongs su gyur pa la sogs pa rang las pa nyid thob pa la nyes pa spang @260a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyis bcas na yang gnas khang yongs su gyur pa la sogs pa rang las pa nyid thob pa la nyes pa spang @260a * //
translated: If another has spread it, one should avoid the fault in taking it up by oneself in a place that has been transformed into one's own dwelling place, and so on.

original: bar bya'o // sbyin pa pos mya ngan bsang ba'i phyir phul ba des mthong bar gzhag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis rang gi ma shi ba'i mya ngan bsang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bar bya'o // sbyin pa pos mya ngan bsang ba'i phyir phul ba des mthong bar gzhag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis rang gi ma shi ba'i mya ngan bsang ba'i phyir /
translated: One should not keep what has been offered by a donor for the purpose of dispelling sorrow, means that King Prasenajit, for the purpose of dispelling the sorrow of his mother's death, offered a robe to the Blessed One.

original: ma'i mal khri dge 'dun la phul ba dge slong gis sgo khang dang khyams su bshams pa rgyal pos mthong nas /
analyzed: ma'i mal khri dge 'dun la phul ba dge slong gis sgo khang dang khyams su bshams pa rgyal pos mthong nas /
translated: The mother offered the bed to the Sangha, and the monks set it up in the courtyard. The king saw it🔽and again was overcome with grief.

original: yang mya ngan lngas pa byung ba'i mtha' las bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: yang mya ngan lngas pa byung ba'i mtha' las bcas pa yin te /
translated: The Buddha laid down the rule:

original: de lta bu'i rdzas spyin bdag gis mthong bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rdzas spyin bdag gis mthong bar mi bya'o //
translated: “The owner of the goods should not see them.”🔽“For the sake of the people of Kuru, it should be set up in the courtyard on the eighth and the fourteenth.”

original: sgra mi snyan pa'i gnyen po'i phyir tshe brgyad dang bcu bzhi dag la khyams su bsham par bya'o zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni de rnams kyis mal khri de bkrus so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra mi snyan pa'o //
analyzed: sgra mi snyan pa'i gnyen po'i phyir tshe brgyad dang bcu bzhi dag la khyams su bsham par bya'o zhes bya'o zhes bya ba ni de rnams kyis mal khri de bkrus so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra mi snyan pa'o //
translated: The people of Kuru are unpleasant to hear because they say, “They washed that bed,” and so on.

original: de bsal ba'i gnyen po'i phyir bsham zhing gzhan gyis mthong bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bsal ba'i gnyen po'i phyir bsham zhing gzhan gyis mthong bar bya'o //
translated: For the sake of dispelling that unpleasantness, it should be set up and seen by others.

original: khri dang khri'u bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni bye brag ma smos pa'i phyir gang zag gis kyang ngo zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: khri dang khri'u bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni bye brag ma smos pa'i phyir gang zag gis kyang ngo zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: “One should keep a bed and a bench” means that since no distinction is made, it should be understood that it is also for individuals.

original: ma mo las 'di ni bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin no ;
analyzed: ma mo las 'di ni bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa yin no ;
translated: This is what is said up to “This is the rule.”

original: / spyil ba mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir khri rkang gi mthil mnyam par spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: / spyil ba mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir khri rkang gi mthil mnyam par spyad par bya'o //
translated: In order to prevent the hut from being damaged, the legs of the bed should be equipped with bases.

original: yang de'i 'og tu phub ma'i phung po gzhag pa'am de ras mas dkri bar bya'o zhes bya ba las /
analyzed: yang de'i 'og tu phub ma'i phung po gzhag pa'am de ras mas dkri bar bya'o zhes bya ba las /
translated: Then, below that, a bundle of straw should be placed, or it should be wrapped in cloth.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni khri'u'i rkang pa de'i 'og tu'o //🔽dge 'dun ma yin pas rkang pa dkris pa'i khri'u bsten pa bdag gir mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni sil bu dag las sgron ma'i shing shes par bya ba'i bar du yang ngo //🔽stan bzang po dang rgyab rten dang bcas ba'i stan yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba yang dge 'dun ma yin pas bdag gir bya ba bsten par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni khri'u'i rkang pa de'i 'og tu'o // dge 'dun ma yin pas rkang pa dkris pa'i khri'u bsten pa bdag gir mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni sil bu dag las sgron ma'i shing shes par bya ba'i bar du yang ngo // stan bzang po dang rgyab rten dang bcas ba'i stan yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba yang dge 'dun ma yin pas bdag gir bya ba bsten par mi bya ba'o //
translated: In the phrase then, below that, that refers to the legs of the bed.🔽A bed with legs wrapped in cloth should not be used by anyone other than the saṅgha. This also applies to the use of a bed with legs wrapped in cloth that is owned by the saṅgha.🔽A good bed with a back support should not be used also means that a bed owned by the saṅgha should not be used.

original: mar me'i sdong bu yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni shing ljon pa'i rnam pa 'dra ba'i mar me'i sdong bu yang dge 'dun ma yin pas bdag gir bya ba bsten par mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: mar me'i sdong bu yang mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni shing ljon pa'i rnam pa 'dra ba'i mar me'i sdong bu yang dge 'dun ma yin pas bdag gir bya ba bsten par mi bya ba'o //
translated: A lamp wick should not be made. This means that a lamp wick shaped like a tree should not be used by anyone other than the saṅgha.

original: 'dir gzhung ni /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni /
translated: Here, the text says:

original: dge 'dun la ni yal ga gcig pa'i mar me'i sdong po rnyed na yang rjes su gnang ngo //
analyzed: dge 'dun la ni yal ga gcig pa'i mar me'i sdong po rnyed na yang rjes su gnang ngo //
translated: “If a single-branched lamp-wick holder is found, it is permitted for the Saṅgha.

original: gang zag la ni rjes su ma gnang ngo //
analyzed: gang zag la ni rjes su ma gnang ngo //
translated: It is not permitted for an individual.

original: yal ga gnyis pa dang mang po yang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: yal ga gnyis pa dang mang po yang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The same applies to two-branched and many-branched ones.”🔽Some texts say “many-branched,”

original: kha cig las ni yal ga du ma pa zhes so zhes bya ba ni lugs kha cig las ni yal ga dum dang ldan ba'i mar me'i sdong po dge 'dun ma yin pas bdag gir bya ba bsten par mi bya'o //
analyzed: kha cig las ni yal ga du ma pa zhes so zhes bya ba ni lugs kha cig las ni yal ga dum dang ldan ba'i mar me'i sdong po dge 'dun ma yin pas bdag gir bya ba bsten par mi bya'o //
translated: Some texts say that a lamp-wick holder with many branches is not to be used by anyone who is not a member of the Saṅgha.

original: yal ga gcig dang ldan pa bdag gir byas pa la ni nyes pa med do zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yal ga gcig dang ldan pa bdag gir byas pa la ni nyes pa med do zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: There is no fault in using one with a single branch.🔽“One should use a square cushion with a lining and a pillow with a lining.”

original: stan nang @260b tshangs can gru bzhi dang sngas nang tshangs can bcang par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bye brag ma gtogs pa'i phyir thams cad kyis bcang bar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: stan nang @260b tshangs can gru bzhi dang sngas nang tshangs can bcang par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bye brag ma gtogs pa'i phyir thams cad kyis bcang bar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood to apply to everyone, except in special cases.

original: stan nang tshangs can zhes bya ba ni shing bal can no //
analyzed: stan nang tshangs can zhes bya ba ni shing bal can no //
translated: A “cushion with a lining” is one with cotton batting.

original: 'dir gzhung ni ma mo las stan nang tshangs can gru bzhi dang sngas nang tshangs can bcang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni ma mo las stan nang tshangs can gru bzhi dang sngas nang tshangs can bcang bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Here the scripture is: “One should use a mat with a square border and a pillow with a border.”

original: sngas nang tshangs can gyi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir khru bzhi pa dang do pa nyis bltab tu bya ste /
analyzed: sngas nang tshangs can gyi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir khru bzhi pa dang do pa nyis bltab tu bya ste /
translated: In order to show the nature of a pillow with a border, it says: “Four cubits long and two cubits wide, it is sewn.”

original: btsem mo zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: btsem mo zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is sewn.

original: srid du ni khru bzhi pa nyis bltab dang zheng du ni khru do pa nyis bltab tu byas te btsem mo //
analyzed: srid du ni khru bzhi pa nyis bltab dang zheng du ni khru do pa nyis bltab tu byas te btsem mo //
translated: It is four cubits long and two cubits wide, and it is sewn.

original: shing bal gyis brdzang ngo //
analyzed: shing bal gyis brdzang ngo //
translated: It is stuffed with cotton.

original: so sor brtag pa ma byas par nyal bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni mal dang stan 'di la so sor brtag pa ma byas na so sor brtag pa ma bya pa zhes bya ba 'dis bsdus ba'o //
analyzed: so sor brtag pa ma byas par nyal bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni mal dang stan 'di la so sor brtag pa ma byas na so sor brtag pa ma bya pa zhes bya ba 'dis bsdus ba'o //
translated: One should not sleep without examining it” means that if one does not examine this bed or seat, it is included in “without examining.”

original: 'dir gzhung ni dge slong nyal bar byed na so sor brtags te nyal bar bya'o zhes gsungs ba yin no //

translated: Here the scripture is: “If a monk is going to sleep, he should sleep while examining.”

original: dran pa nye bar ma bzhag par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge ba brtsams pa dang 'brel ba dang dge ba'i phyogs gzhan dang 'brel ba dang / dus ji lta ba bzhin du ldang ba dang 'brel ba dan lus dan gos mi 'phyar ba dag 'brel ba'i dra pa yin par rig par bya'o //

translated: One should not be without the foundations of mindfulness means that one should be mindful of the connection with the practice of virtue, the connection with other virtuous things, and the connection with rising at the appropriate time, and one should be mindful of the connection with not shaking one's body or clothes.

analyzed: gzhan la zhes smos pa ni stegs bu la sogs pa'i khri dag bsdu'o //

analyzed: ngo tsha shes pa med na stan so sor bting ste gtur bu'am lhung bzed kyi snod la sogs pas rab tu bcad nas dran pa nye bar gzhag ste nyal bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni reg pa'am kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen por gyur pa zhes bya ba
translated: If one lacks a sense of shame, one should lie down on separate beds, separated by a box or a bowl, etc., with the foundations of mindfulness present. The antidote to contact or defilement means that one should lie down with the thought of rising at the appropriate time.

original: shugs kyis shes pa'o //

original: der 'os pa kha bsgyur ro //

original: dge 'dun sbyin bdag yin pa'i yang rnam par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun sbyin bdag yin pa'i yang rnam par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: It should be used by the one who is the donor of the Saṅgha.

original: der mi mkho ba nyid yin na 'jim pa dang bsres te dkon mchog dag gi rtsig pa dang / ka ba dang sgo glegs kyi ser ka dag byug pa'i phyir de la nan tan bya'o zhes bya ba la /

translated: If it is not needed there, one should mix it with clay and apply it to the cracks in the walls, pillars, and doors of the Three Jewels.

original: der mi mkho ba nyid yin na zhes bya ba ni mar me'i snying po der ro //
analyzed: der mi mkho ba nyid yin na zhes bya ba ni mar me'i snying po der ro //
translated: “If it is not needed there” means in the lamp.

analyzed: dkon mchog dag gi zhes bya ba ni dkon mchog dang 'brel pa rnams la'o //
translated: “Of the Three Jewels” means in relation to the Three Jewels.

analyzed: @262a * // de la nan tan bya'o zhes bya ba ni bsrad pa la sogs pa de rnams la nan tan bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase one should apply oneself to that means that one should apply oneself to those duties of assigning and so on.

original: gnas mal ji lta bur gyur pa sus bsrad pa la sogs pa'i nan tan bya zhe na /
analyzed: gnas mal ji lta bur gyur pa sus bsrad pa la sogs pa'i nan tan bya zhe na /
translated: With regard to the question, Who should apply oneself to the duties of assigning and so on that have been performed?

original: de'i phyir bskos pa ni mnos pas so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bskos pa ni mnos pas so zhes bya ba smos te /

translated: The remainder are to be included by the saṃgha, and the duties of assigning and so on are to be carried out. How are they to be included and carried out?

analyzed: de'i phyir gand'i brdungs pas bsdus te'o zhes bya ba smos te'o //

translated: If one sees that the saṃgha's property is being stolen or robbed and one has the ability, one should not fail to stop it.

original: rku 'phrog ni dpe tsam du zad de /
analyzed: rku 'phrog ni dpe tsam du zad de /

original: gnas sum son gyi bar du khyer bar byed pas longs spyod par bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni bskrad pa ni dge 'dun gyi dngos po yal bar dor te blangs pa gang yin pa de ni dge slong gi gnas su ma son gyi bar du
analyzed: gnas sum son gyi bar du khyer bar byed pas longs spyod par bya ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni bskrad pa ni dge 'dun gyi dngos po yal bar dor te blangs pa gang yin pa de ni dge slong gi gnas su ma son gyi bar du
translated: When expelled, the Saṅgha’s property is lost to the person who took it.

translated: If they are all equally despised, then the one who is the most senior should be served.🔽If he is not accepted, he should not be removed from that.

analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni ma zin pa nyid do //
translated: That means he is not accepted.

original: der zhes bya ba ni chab khung la'o //

original: zhugs pa nyid na zhes bya ba ni ma zin na'o //
analyzed: zhugs pa nyid na zhes bya ba ni ma zin na'o //
translated: If he enters means if he is not accepted.

analyzed: sgom pa'i phyir 'dug pa bslong bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la 'dug pa zhes bya ba ni sgom pa'o //
translated: One should not disturb a monk who is sitting for the purpose of meditation.🔽“Sitting” means meditation.

original: de la rgan rims su mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dug pa de la rgan rims su mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la rgan rims su mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni 'dug pa de la rgan rims su mi bya'o //
translated: “One should not treat him with respect” means one should not treat him with the respect due to seniority.

original: 'on kyang 'di ltar 'ongs pas bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di ltar 'ongs pas bya ba ste /
translated: “But one should do this” means one should do what is proper for a guest.

original: 'dug pa la nye bar mkho ba'i stan la sogs pa rnams la ji ltar 'ongs pa nyid kyis longs spyad pa ste /
analyzed: 'dug pa la nye bar mkho ba'i stan la sogs pa rnams la ji ltar 'ongs pa nyid kyis longs spyad pa ste /
translated: One should use the seat and other things necessary for sitting as they are, without treating them with respect due to seniority.

original: ji ltar rgan rims su longs spyad par bya ba ma yin te de bas na de'i 'di bya @263a * //
analyzed: ji ltar rgan rims su longs spyad par bya ba ma yin te de bas na de'i 'di bya @263a * //
translated: Therefore, this is what one should do in this case.

original: ba'o ; /'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag spong ba'i khang pa na 'khod cing dge ba'i phyogs dag byed pa na /
analyzed: ba'o ; /'dir gzhung ni dge slong dag spong ba'i khang pa na 'khod cing dge ba'i phyogs dag byed pa na /
translated: Here is the text: When monks were sitting in the forest huts and practicing virtue,

original: drug sde dag 'ongs te nged cag rgan no zhes bya bas slong bar byed pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: drug sde dag 'ongs te nged cag rgan no zhes bya bas slong bar byed pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: the group of six came and said, “We are senior,” and disturbed them. The Blessed One said,

original: 'di la rgan rims su mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la rgan rims su mi bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “One should not treat him with respect in this case.”

original: dge slong las dang zas kyis 'bags pa mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni las dang zas brtsams pas 'bags pa bslang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong las dang zas kyis 'bags pa mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni las dang zas brtsams pas 'bags pa bslang bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not be defiled by the actions and food of a monk means that one should not be defiled by undertaking the actions and food.

original: byug ris ma yin par 'dug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni rang gi go ma yin pa ni byug ris ma yin pa ste der 'dug par mi bya'o //
analyzed: byug ris ma yin par 'dug par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni rang gi go ma yin pa ni byug ris ma yin pa ste der 'dug par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not sit in a place that is not painted means that one should not sit in a place that is not one's own, which is not painted.

original: bya ba byas nas 'khor zhing spyad pa 'dod pa yod na bcang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bya ba byas nas 'khor zhing spyad pa 'dod pa yod na bcang bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba la /
translated: If one desires to practice the conduct while engaged in activity, one should not hold it.

original: 'khor zhing spyad pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'os pa'i spyod pa la spyad par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'khor zhing spyad pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'os pa'i spyod pa la spyad par bya ba'o //
translated: The conduct of practice means that one should engage in the conduct that is appropriate.

original: bar du don gyi ched nyid du khri'u las langs pa ni bya ba byas pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bar ma bya ba nyid kyi dbang gis tha ma byas pa nyid la du dung las snga ma brtsams pa gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: bar du don gyi ched nyid du khri'u las langs pa ni bya ba byas pa nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bar ma bya ba nyid kyi dbang gis tha ma byas pa nyid la du dung las snga ma brtsams pa gang yin pa dang /
translated: If one rises from the seat for the sake of the meaning in between, it is not the activity that is done. That is, by the power of the intermediate activity, the final activity is not done. Whatever was begun earlier,

original: khri'u las babs pa gang yin pa de la 'di bya ba byas pa nyid du shes par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: khri'u las babs pa gang yin pa de la 'di bya ba byas pa nyid du shes par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not to be understood that he has done what is to be done, if he gets down from the bench.

original: de'i dus na de la chos gos sam pus 'khyud gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni khri'u'o //
analyzed: de'i dus na de la chos gos sam pus 'khyud gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni khri'u'o //
translated: At that time, he should place his Dharma robe or his upper robe on the bench.

original: de'i dus na zhes bya ba ni bar ma byas pa nyid kyi dbang gis dus la btang ba'i dus la'o //🔽'dod pa yod la gnas yod na dge 'dun gyi spags pa nyid brten par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gal te don du gnyer ba gzhan dag yod na 'gro ba yang yo na des dge 'dun gyi yo byad sbags pa nyid sten par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i dus na zhes bya ba ni bar ma byas pa nyid kyi dbang gis dus la btang ba'i dus la'o // 'dod pa yod la gnas yod na dge 'dun gyi spags pa nyid brten par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni gal te don du gnyer ba gzhan dag yod na 'gro ba yang yo na des dge 'dun gyi yo byad sbags pa nyid sten par mi bya'o //
translated: At that time means at the time of being sent, by the power of being in the middle.🔽If there is a desire and there is a place, he should not rely on the Saṅgha’s bedding.🔽If there are other seekers, and if he is going, then he should not rely on the Saṅgha’s bedding.

original: don yod na rnams pa de lta bu las bral bar byas pa la kha na ma thob med do zhes ba ni don yod pa nyid dang 'dod pa'i gang zag gzhan yod pa la gang la sbags pa yod pa nyid bsten pa'o //
analyzed: don yod na rnams pa de lta bu las bral bar byas pa la kha na ma thob med do zhes ba ni don yod pa nyid dang 'dod pa'i gang zag gzhan yod pa la gang la sbags pa yod pa nyid bsten pa'o //
translated: If there is a purpose, there is no offense in separating from that kind of bedding. If there is a purpose, and if there is another person who desires it, then he should rely on the bedding that is there.

original: de lta bur gyur pa las yo byad de las bral bar bya ste khyer ba la kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa las yo byad de las bral bar bya ste khyer ba la kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
translated: But if it is not like that, then it is not wrong to take away that article and carry it off.

original: ci dgos pa med kyang kha na ma tho ba med pa yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci dgos pa med kyang kha na ma tho ba med pa yin nam zhe na /
translated: But if there is no need, is it not wrong?

original: de'i phyir / don yod na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / don yod na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, “if there is a purpose.”

original: dgos pa yod pa la yin gyi med na ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dgos pa yod pa la yin gyi med na ni ma yin no //
translated: It is if there is a need, but not if there is not.

original: dge 'dun gyi mchig dang mchig gu bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi mchig dang mchig gu bcang bar bya'o //
translated: One should keep a mortar and pestle for the Saṅgha.

original: 'dreg mkhan gyi lag cha yang ngo zhes bya ba yang bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i rdzas snyegs pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra smos te /
analyzed: 'dreg mkhan gyi lag cha yang ngo zhes bya ba yang bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i rdzas snyegs pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra smos te /
translated: One should also keep the barber’s tools. The word “also” is used to include the substance.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi phyir bcad pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi phyir bcad pa'o //
translated: It is cut for the Saṅgha of monks.

original: snod du bcug ste rtsig pa la @263b gzhag go zhes bya ba ni 'dreg mkhan gyi lag cha'o //
analyzed: snod du bcug ste rtsig pa la @263b gzhag go zhes bya ba ni 'dreg mkhan gyi lag cha'o //
translated: It is put in a container and placed on a wall.

original: 'dir gzhung ni phran tshegs dag las /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni phran tshegs dag las /
translated: The text here is from the Ksudraka Collection.

original: dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi phyir 'dreg mkhan gyi lag cha bcang bar bya zhing snod du bcug ste rtsig pa la gzhag par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: dge slong gis dge 'dun gyi phyir 'dreg mkhan gyi lag cha bcang bar bya zhing snod du bcug ste rtsig pa la gzhag par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Monks should use barbers’ tools for the sake of the Saṅgha, and they should be kept in a container and placed against a wall.🔽The words “and so on” in the passage “an adze, an ax, a chisel, and so on” refer to the fact that the Saṅgha should keep the tools and their containers.

original: ste'u dang sta re dang gzong la sogs pa dang de dag gi snod dang bcas pa yang ngo zhes bya ba yang dge 'dun gyis bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i rjes snyegs pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra smos te /
analyzed: ste'u dang sta re dang gzong la sogs pa dang de dag gi snod dang bcas pa yang ngo zhes bya ba yang dge 'dun gyis bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i rjes snyegs pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba'i sgra smos te /
translated: The words “and so on” in the passage “an adze, an ax, a chisel, and so on” refer to the fact that the Saṅgha should keep the tools and their containers.

original: de dag gi snod dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni ste'u dang sta re dang gzong la sogs pa de dag gi snod do //
analyzed: de dag gi snod dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni ste'u dang sta re dang gzong la sogs pa de dag gi snod do //
translated: The container for an adze, an ax, a chisel, and so on is a box for an adze, an ax, a chisel, and so on.

original: 'dir gzhung ni shing dag gshags par mi nus nas /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung ni shing dag gshags par mi nus nas /
translated: Here is the story. The monks were unable to cut wood.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dge 'dun gyi phyir ste'u dang sta re dang gzong bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi phyir ste'u dang sta re dang gzong bcang bar bya'o //
translated: “For the sake of the Saṅgha, you should keep an adze, an ax, and a chisel.”

original: dge slong zhig gi hri chag nas dge slong des smras pa na kho bo la gzod yod de zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: dge slong zhig gi hri chag nas dge slong des smras pa na kho bo la gzod yod de zhes bya ba nas /
translated: A monk’s hoe broke. The monk said, “I have one that is new.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dben pa'i phyogs su bya'o //
analyzed: dben pa'i phyogs su bya'o //
translated: It should be done in a secluded place.

original: dge 'dun gi ste'u dang snod kyang bcang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gi ste'u dang snod kyang bcang bar bya'o //
translated: The Sangha's tools and vessels should also be kept.

original: gang zag gis 'chang na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zag gis 'chang na 'gal tshabs can du 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If an individual keeps them, it is a transgression.

original: nges g-yar po nyid du sa las byas pa yang chad sbyin no zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun des dge slong de la lag cha'i snod tha nas las byas pa yang chad kyang g-yar po nyid du sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nges g-yar po nyid du sa las byas pa yang chad sbyin no zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun des dge slong de la lag cha'i snod tha nas las byas pa yang chad kyang g-yar po nyid du sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Even if made of clay, it should be given as a loan, means that the Sangha should give that monk a tool vessel, even if made of clay, as a loan.

original: dge slong mas mching bu'i snod bcang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong mas mching bu'i snod bcang bar mi bya'o //
translated: A nun should not keep a vessel made of shell.

original: thams cad kyis 'bru mar gyi snod bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong dang dge slong ma thams cad gyis so //
analyzed: thams cad kyis 'bru mar gyi snod bcang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge slong dang dge slong ma thams cad gyis so //
translated: All should keep an oil vessel, means all monks and nuns.

original: phul gang man chad nas phul phyed yan chad shong ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phul gang man chad nas phul phyed yan chad shong ba'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: From one prastha up to half a prastha, means

original: 'dir yan chad kyi sgra bri bar bya ste phul phyed yan chad ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'dir yan chad kyi sgra bri bar bya ste phul phyed yan chad ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Here, the word “and” should be written, meaning “and so on up to a half-prapta.”

original: lcags kyi dog le yang ngo zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyis bcang bar bya'o //🔽de'i lcags sgyed kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni lcags kyi dog le'i lcags sgyed rkang pa gsum pa'am /
analyzed: lcags kyi dog le yang ngo zhes bya ba ni thams cad kyis bcang bar bya'o // de'i lcags sgyed kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni lcags kyi dog le'i lcags sgyed rkang pa gsum pa'am /
translated: “Also iron bowls” means that all should use them.

original: rkang pa bzhi pa yang bcad bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: rkang pa bzhi pa yang bcad bar bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: “Also iron tripods” means that all should use iron bowls and three-legged or four-legged iron tripods.🔽This is what is said.

original: sa las byas pa'i thab kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni rgya thab dang skyed po yang bcang bar bya'o //
